This alignment of cosmic energies with the annual energies results in a harmonious year where the stars operate within their proper measures without overwhelming dominance.】 Thus, if the yearly influence is excessive, the ruling star will lose its brilliance and be compromised by its mother influence. If it is insufficient, its appearance will be affected by what it cannot withstand. 【Note: This continues the previous discussion; for example, if the yearly Wood influence is excessive, the ruling star will overreach into territories it cannot dominate, thus losing luminosity. If the yearly Earth influence is excessive, the ruling star will invade territories of Water it cannot overcome, resulting in the losing star losing luminosity.】[102p]

兼其母者，谓畏星之母，亦兼失其色。盖畏星之母，即胜星之子，谓亢则害，而不能生化其子气也。如不及之岁，则所不胜之星，亦兼见其色。如岁木不及，则所胜之太白增光，而所不胜之土气无畏，其镇星亦兼见其色矣。五运相同。】　　肖者瞿瞿，莫知其妙，闵闵之当，孰者为良？　　 【注　肖，取法也。瞿瞿，却顾貌。谓取法星象之吉凶，莫能知其微妙。闵闵，多忧也。忧瞻星象喜怒燥泽之当，当以孰法为良，盖甚言其星象之不易占也。】　　妄行无征，示畏侯王。[103p]

Those who share in the essence of their mother are said to share in the essence of the Mother of the Stars of Fear, which also loses its color. The Mother of the Stars of Fear is the same as the Child of the Winning Star, suggesting that when it becomes excessive, it causes harm, and cannot nurture its child’s essence. In a year when the influences are insufficient, the stars that are not conquered also simultaneously appear in color. For example, if wood is insufficient in the year, the influencing star, the Bright White Star, increases in brightness, while the energy of the earth that is not conquered is fearless; thus, its stable star also simultaneously reveals its color. The five movements are the same.

The resemblance is obscure, and none can grasp its subtleties. Those who are mournful—who sets the good standard?

(Note: The term "resemblance" refers to following a principle or model; "obscure" indicates a perplexing demeanor. This suggests that when taking guidance from star patterns—good or ill—none can fully understand their subtle intricacies. The sentiment of being mournful indicates an anxiety in observing the star’s consistency of change in emotions and conditions, questioning which law should be preferred, highlighting the difficulty in divining star patterns.)

Irresponsible actions lack basis, indicating fear toward the ruler.[103p]

　　 【注　不求良法，而妄言占象，则所言之吉凶，皆无征验矣，反以祸福之说，而示畏于侯王。此言天官家之不学无术。】　　帝曰：其灾应何如？岐伯曰：亦各从其化也。故时至有盛衰，凌犯有逆顺，留守有多少，形见有善恶，宿属有胜负，征应有吉凶矣。　　 【注　灾应谓五星之变，下应民物之灾眚，各从五运之气化也。五星之应时而至，有盛有衰，彼此凌犯，有顺有逆；留守之日，有多有少；所见之象，有喜润之善，有忧怒之恶；五宿之属，有胜星之胜，有畏星之负；下应于君民，有福德之吉，有灾病之凶。】　　帝曰：其善恶，何谓也？岐伯曰：有喜有怒，有忧有丧，有泽有燥。此象之常也，必谨察之。[104p]

Annotations: If one does not seek good methods but makes reckless statements about omens, then whatever is said about fortune and misfortune lacks evidence. This only serves to instill fear in lords and kings, indicating a lack of learning and skill in diviners.

The Emperor asked: What are the indications of calamity? Qi Bo replied: Each calamity comes from its own transformation. Therefore, there are times of prosperity and decline, violations of proper order, varying numbers of protective forces, visible signs of good and evil, conditions of victory and defeat, and manifestations of fortune and misfortune.

Annotations: The indications of calamity refer to changes in the five planets, which result in disasters affecting the populace. Each follows the energies of the five elements. The changes in the five planets occur in due time, bringing both prosperity and decline, with mutual violations and proper sequences; on certain days of protection, there are many or few; the visible signs may indicate joy and abundance or worry and anger; the five constellations may reflect victories or losses; they correspond to the ruler and the people, yielding blessings of virtue or disasters and illness.

The Emperor asked: What do you mean by good and evil? Qi Bo replied: There is joy and anger, worry and mourning, abundance and drought. These are the constants of signs, and they must be carefully observed.[104p]

　　 【注　王冰曰：五星之见也，从夜深见之。人见之喜，星之喜也；见之畏，星之怒也。光色微曜，乍明乍暗，星之忧也；光色迥然，不彰不莹，不与众同，星之丧也；光色圆明，不盈不缩，怡然莹然，星之喜也；光色勃然临人，芒彩满溢，其象凛然，星之怒也。】　　帝曰：六者高下异乎？岐伯曰：象见高下，其应一也。故人亦应之。　　 【注　此言喜、怒、忧、丧、泽、燥六者之象，虽高远而小，下近而大，其应一也，故人应之而为吉凶、祸福，亦无有分别也。】　　帝曰：善！其德化、政令之动静，损益皆何如？岐伯曰：夫德化、政令，灾变不能相加也。　　 【注　王冰曰：天地动静，阴阳往复，以德报德，以化报化。政令灾眚及动复亦然。故曰：不能相加也。】　　胜复盛衰，不能相多也。[105p]

[Note: Wang Bing said: The appearance of the Five Stars occurs when seen in the deep of night. When people see it, they feel joy; this is the joy of the stars. If they see it with fear, this is the anger of the stars. When the light is dim and flickering, appearing sometimes bright and sometimes dark, this reflects the worry of the stars. When the light is completely distinct, neither bright nor dull, and does not resemble others, this signifies the loss of the stars. When the light is round and clear, neither growing nor shrinking, appearing serene and radiant, this is the joy of the stars. When the light comes forth with intensity, overflowing with brilliance, and its appearance is awe-inspiring, this indicates the anger of the stars.] The Emperor asked: Are the six phenomena different in height and depth? Qi Bo answered: The manifestations vary in height and depth, yet their responses are unified; hence, people respond correspondingly. [Note: This refers to the manifestations of joy, anger, worry, loss, grace, and dryness. Despite being high or small, near or far, their responses are unified, allowing people to respond and determine auspiciousness or misfortune without distinction.] The Emperor said: Good! What about the effects of virtue and governance on movement and stillness, loss and gain? Qi Bo replied: Virtue and governance cannot increase through calamities and changes. [Note: Wang Bing said: The movements and stillness of heaven and earth, the cyclical changes of yin and yang, repay virtue with virtue and transformation with transformation. The effects of governance and disasters are the same; hence, they cannot increase.] Prosperity and decline cannot be multiplied.[105p]

　　 【注　王冰曰：胜盛复盛，胜微复微。故曰，不能相多也。】　　往来小大，不能相过也。
　　【注　太过为大年，不及为小年。有余而往，不足随之；不足而往，有余从之。故曰，不能相过也。】　　用之升降，不能相无也。
　　 【注　用，谓阴阳气之为用也。天地阴阳之气，升已而降，降已而升；寒往则暑来，暑往则寒来。故曰，不能相无也。】　　各从其动而复之耳。[106p]

【Note: Wang Bing said: "Victory overshadows abundance, and victory diminishes abundance. Therefore, it is said that they cannot exceed each other." The interactions of the small and large also cannot surpass one another.】

【Note: Excess leads to a great year, insufficiency leads to a small year. When there is surplus, it goes forth,but when there is a lack, it follows behind; hence, it is said that they cannot surpass one another.】 The use of ascending and descending also cannot exist without each other.

【Note: 'Use' refers to the operation of yin and yang energies. The qi of heaven and earth, when it ascends, then descends; when it descends, then ascends. Cold follows warmth, and warmth follows cold. Therefore, it is said that they cannot exist without each other.】 Each acts according to its movement and returns accordingly.[106p]

　　 【注　谓胜复之往来，阴阳之升降，各从其气之动而复之。六微旨论曰：成败倚伏生乎动。动而不已，则变作矣！】　　帝曰：其病生，何如？岐伯曰：气化者德之祥，政令者气之章，变易者复之纪，灾眚者伤之始。　　 【注　此言病生于变易也。岁气之有德有化，乃气之和祥也；有政有令，乃气之章着也。变易者，报复之纪；灾眚者，乃民病所伤之始。】　　气相胜者和，不相胜者病。重感于邪则甚也。　　 【注　气谓变易之气。按六节脏象论曰：变至则病，所胜则微，所不胜则病，因而重感于邪则死矣。故非其时则微；当其时则甚也。盖谓春时变长夏之气，长夏变冬气，冬变夏热之气，夏变秋气，秋变春气。所谓得五行时之胜，乃时气相胜变气，故为和平。如岁木不及，岁金太过，春时反变为肃杀。[107p]

Note: The interactions of winning and losing, the ascension and descension of yin and yang, all follow the movements of their respective energies. The Treatise on the Six Subtle Points states: Success and failure depend on movement. If there is unceasing movement, then transformation occurs!

The Emperor asked: How does illness arise? Qi Bo replied: The transformation of qi is an omen of virtue; political decrees represent the manifestation of qi; changes indicate the pattern of return; disasters and misfortunes mark the beginning of harm.

Note: This refers to illness arising from changes. The quality and transformation of seasonal qi is the harmony of qi; having governance and decrees signifies the elucidation of qi. Changes are indicative of retribution, while disasters and misfortunes originate from the harm experienced by the people.

When qi overcomes one another, there is harmony; when it does not, there is illness. Severe affliction from the pathogenic influence leads to serious conditions.

Note: Qi refers to the transformative energy. According to the Treatise on the Six Organs and Their Correspondences, illness arises upon change; what is overcome is subtle, while what is not is illness, leading to severe affliction from the pathogenic influence resulting in death. Thus, if conditions are not right, it remains subtle; when conditions are right, it becomes severe. This refers to the transition of qi: spring transforms into the energy of late summer, late summer into winter qi, winter transitions to the heat of summer, summer shifts to autumn qi, and autumn reverts back to spring qi. The concept of achieving the victories of the five elements in their appropriate times leads to the mutual victory and transformation of seasonal qi, resulting in harmony. If the wood element does not flourish in spring, and if the metal element becomes excessive, then spring can turn into a season of harshness.[107p]

如岁火不及，岁水太过，夏时应热，而反寒气流行，是时气与变气不相胜则病矣。故非其所胜之时则微，当其所胜之时则甚也。重感于邪者，谓四时不正之邪也。】　　帝曰：善！所谓精光之论，大圣之业，宣明大道，通于无穷，究于无极也。余闻之，善言天者，必应于人；善言古者，必验于今；善言气者，必彰于物；善言应者，同天地之化。善言化、言变者，通神明之理。非夫子孰能言至道欤？　　 【注　精光之论，论神明之理也。大圣之业，通于无穷者，上以治民，下以治身，德泽下流，传之后世，无有终时也。《易》曰：知变化之道者，其知神之所为乎？】　　乃择良兆而藏之灵室，每旦读之，命曰气交变。非斋戒不敢发，慎传也。　　 【注　灵室，灵兰秘室。盖天地阴阳之道，上帝之所贵也，非斋戒不敢发，敬谨之至，恐传非其人，慢泄天宝也。】[108p]

If the fire of the year is insufficient and the water of the year is excessive, during summer it should be hot, yet cold air prevails; at this time, the seasonal energies do not overcome the transformed energies, leading to illness. Therefore, when the time is not suitable for overcoming, it is mild; when the time is suitable for overcoming, it is severe. Those who are heavily affected by evils refer to the evils of the four seasons being out of order.

The Emperor said: "Good! The discussion of the essence of light, the great sage's undertaking, clarifies the great way and connects to the infinite, reaching the boundless. I have heard that a good expression of heavenly concepts must resonate with humanity; a good expression of antiquity must validate in the present; a good expression of qi must manifest in things; a good expression of response harmonizes with the transformations of heaven and earth. Those who speak well of transformation and change convey the principles of the divine. Who but the Master can articulate the ultimate way?"

[Note: The discussion of the essence of light refers to the principles of the divine. The great sage's undertaking reaches the infinite, governing the people above and cultivating oneself below, with virtue and grace flowing downwards, bestowed upon future generations, with no end in sight. The Book of Changes states: “Those who understand the way of transformation know what the divine accomplishes.”]

He then chose a good omen and stored it in the spiritual chamber, reading it every morning, calling it the interplay of qi and change. He did not dare to speak it without fasting and performing self-discipline, exercising caution in its transmission.

[Note: The spiritual chamber refers to the secret space of the spiritual orchid. It represents the way of yin and yang of heaven and earth, which the supreme deity values. Not daring to speak it without fasting demonstrates utmost respect and caution, fearing to pass it on to the wrong person and carelessly disclose the heavenly treasures.][108p]

　　　　　五常政大论 【上】

　　黄帝问曰：太虚寥廓，五运迥薄，盛衰不同，损益相从。愿闻平气何如而名，何如而纪也？　　 【注　太虚，谓空冥之境。回薄，旋转也。盛衰，太过不及也。有盛衰，则损益相从矣。平气岁会之纪，气之平者也。】　　岐伯对曰：昭乎哉问也！木曰敷和，火曰升明，土曰备化，金曰审平，水曰静顺。　　 【注　言五运之平气，而各有纪名也。东方生风，风生木，木得其平，则敷布阳和之气，以生万物。火性炎上，其德显明。土主化物，而周备于四方。金主肃杀，得其和平，不妄刑也。水体清静，性柔而顺。】　　帝曰：其不及奈何？岐伯曰：木曰委和，火曰伏明，土曰卑监，金曰从革，水曰涸流。　　 【注　言五运不及，而各有纪名也。木气不及，则不能敷布阳和而委弱矣。[109p]

The Great Discussion on the Five Constants of Governance [Part 1]

The Yellow Emperor asked: "The vastness of the great void is expansive, the five movements rotate irregularly, prosperity and decline differ, and losses and gains follow each other. I wish to know how to define ‘balanced qi’ and what it signifies in terms of regulation."

Qi Bo replied: "What an excellent question! The Wood element represents harmony, Fire signifies brightness and elevation, Earth embodies nurturing transformation, Metal symbolizes refinement and balance, and Water signifies tranquility and acquiescence."

The Emperor said: "What happens when it is inadequate?" Qi Bo replied: "Wood represents waning harmony, Fire indicates concealed brightness, Earth stands for lowered supervision, Metal means following change, and Water signifies diminished flow."

This describes the inadequacy of the five movements, each having its own designation. When the Wood element is lacking, it cannot spread the warm and harmonizing qi and therefore weakens.[109p]

火气不及，则光明之令不升而下伏矣。土气不及，则卑下监守而不能周备于四方矣。金性本刚，不及则从火化而变革矣。水气不及，则源流干涸矣。】　　帝曰：太过何谓？岐伯曰：木曰发生，火曰赫曦，土曰敦阜，金曰坚成，水曰流衍。　　 【注　五运太过，亦各有纪名也。木气有余，发生盛也。赫曦光明，显盛之象。敦厚，阜高也。金体坚刚，用能成物。流衍，满而溢也。】　　帝曰：三气之纪，愿闻其候。岐伯曰：悉乎哉问也！敷和之纪，木德周行，阳舒阴布，五化宣平，其气端，其性随，其用曲直，其化生荣，其类草木，其政发散，其候温和，其令风，其脏肝。肝，其畏清，其主目，其谷麻，其果李，其实核，其应春，其虫毛，其畜犬，其色苍，其养筋，其病里急支满，其味酸，其音角，其物中坚，其数八。[110p]

If the fire energy is insufficient, then the brightness of its decree will not rise but will be subdued. If the earth energy is insufficient, then the lowly will guard but cannot provide for the four directions. The nature of metal is inherently rigid; if it is insufficient, it will change due to the influence of fire. If the water energy is insufficient, then the source and flow will dry up.

The Emperor asked, "What is excessive?" Qibo replied: "Wood signifies growth, fire signifies brilliance, earth signifies stability, metal signifies solidity, and water signifies overflowing."

(Note: The five energies being excessive each have corresponding names. The excess of wood energy is growth at its peak. Brilliance symbolizes abundant light. Stability signifies height and substance. The essence of metal is solid and firm, useful for creation. Overflowing means being full and spilling over.)

The Emperor said, "I wish to hear about the indicators of the three energies." Qibo replied, "What a thorough question! In the season of harmony, the virtue of wood circulates broadly, yang expands while yin disperses, the five transformations are manifested and balanced; their energy is upright, their nature follows, their applications vary, their transformations produce prosperity, they correspond to plants and trees, their governance is expansive, their indicators are warm and harmonious, their decree is wind, and their organ is the liver. The liver fears clarity, governs the eyes, corresponds to hemp grains, fruits that are plums, is solid in form, responds in springtime, corresponds to insect fur, is related to dogs, its color is green, it nourishes tendons, its ailments are urgent fullness in the interior, its flavor is sour, its tone is the horn, its substance is firm in the middle, and its number is eight."[110p]

　　【注　三气谓平气与太过、不及也。木之平运，是为敷和。木德周行，则阳气舒，而阴气布，盖生长化收藏之五气，先由生气之宣布，生气和则五气皆平矣。端，正直也。随，柔顺也。曲直，木之体用也。生荣，木之生化也。类，物类也。发生散蔓，木布之政也。温和，春之候也。在天之风，木之号令也。其在脏则为肝，畏清者，木畏金也。在窍为目。在谷为麻，麻体象木，其色苍也。在果为季，色青而味酸也。核内有仁，仁分两片，木之生原也。毛虫，如草木之森丛，而生于草木者也。犬性勇往直前，感春生怒发之气也。肝主筋，故其养在筋。里急支满，肝之病也。角，木音也。木生于水，为坚多心，故其物主中坚。八者，木之成数也。】　　升明之纪，正阳而治，德施周普，五化均衡。[111p]

The Three Energies refer to the balanced energy and the extremes of excess and deficiency. The balanced motion of wood represents harmony. When the virtue of wood circulates freely, the yang energy expands and the yin energy diffuses, encompassing the five energies of growth, transformation, storage, and their emergence. When the growth energy is harmonious, all five energies are balanced. "Duan" signifies uprightness, while "Sui" embodies softness and obedience. The straight and curved represent the characteristics and utility of wood. "Sheng Rong" refers to the vitality of wood’s growth and transformation. "Lei" pertains to the classification of things. The emergence and scattering signify the governance by wood. "Wen He" indicates the warmth and harmony of spring. The wind in the sky represents the commands of wood. Within the organs, it corresponds to the liver, which fears the clarity that wood resists against metal. It relates to the eyes among the sensory organs. In the grains, it corresponds to hemp, which resembles wood in form and has a green hue. In fruits, it represents the season, appearing green and tasting sour. The core contains the kernel, which is split into two parts, representing the origin of wood’s vitality. Caterpillars, like the dense forests of grass and trees, are born from vegetation. Dogs exhibit a courageous disposition, responding to the rising energy of spring with anger. The liver governs the tendons, therefore its nourishment is in the sinews. Abdominal urgency and fullness are symptoms of liver illness. "Jiao" is the sound of wood, which thrives in water, making it strong and resilient. The number eight is the manifestation of wood. In the era of rising brightness, governance is based on rectified yang, where virtues are widely applied and the five transformations are balanced.[111p]

其气高，其性速，其用燔灼，其化蕃茂，其类火，其政明曜，其候炎暑，其令热，其脏心。心，其畏寒，其主舌，其谷麦，其果杏，其实络，其应夏，其虫羽，其畜马，其色赤，其养血，其病瞤瘛，其味苦，其音征，其物脉，其数七。　　【注　火位南方，故正阳而治。火主阳气，故德施周普。阳和之气四布，五化俱以均平，皆感火之化也。火气炎上，故气高；火性动急，故性速也。烧炙曰燔灼，火之用也。万物蕃茂，夏长之化也。凡在地之火，皆与之同类。明曜，火布之政也。炎暑，夏之候也。在天为热，火之令也。在脏为心，心，其畏寒，火畏水也。心开窍于舌。麦乃夏成之谷。杏色赤，其味苦。络者，果实之脉络。羽虫，飞翔而上，感火气而生。马属午，火之畜。心主血脉，故其养在血。瞤瘛，经脉感火气而缩急也。征，火之音。苦，火之味。脉，物之脉络。七，火之成数也。[112p]

Its energy is high, its nature is swift, its function is to burn and scorch, its transformation is abundant, its kind is fire, its governance is bright and radiant, its climate is hot and sultry, its command is heat, and its organ is the heart. The heart fears cold, it governs the tongue, its grains are wheat, its fruit is apricot, its essence is connected, it responds to summer, its insects fly, its livestock is horses, its color is red, it nourishes blood, its sickness is twitching and convulsions, its taste is bitter, its sound is a signal, its substance is veins, and its number is seven.

(Note: Fire is positioned in the south, hence it governs the Yang. Fire represents Yang energy, whereby virtues are distributed widely. The warmth of Yang energy is extensively disseminated, and all transformations are balanced, all influenced by the transformation of fire. The energy of fire rises high, hence its energy is elevated; its nature is active and urgent, thus it is swift. Burning and scorching is its function. The flourishing of all things is the transformation of summer. All terrestrial fire shares a kindred nature. Brightness and radiance are the governance of fire. Hot and sultry is the climate of summer. In the heavens, it manifests as heat, which is commanded by fire. In the organs, it is the heart; the heart fears cold because fire fears water. The heart opens to the tongue. Wheat is the grain that matures in summer. The color of apricot is red, and its taste is bitter. Connection refers to the veins of the fruit. Insects that can fly are inspired by the energy of fire. Horses belong to the noon, the livestock of fire. The heart governs blood vessels, thus its nourishment is found in blood. Twitching and convulsions occur when the meridians respond to the energy of fire with contraction. Signal is the sound of fire. Bitter is the taste of fire. Veins refer to the networks of substances. Seven is the number representing the essence of fire.)[112p]

】　　备化之纪，气协天休，德流四政，五化齐修。其气平，其性顺，其用高下，其化丰满，其类土，其政安静，其候溽蒸，其令湿，其脏脾。脾，其畏风，其主口，其谷稷，其果枣，其实肉，其应长夏，其虫倮，其畜牛，其色黄，其养肉，其病否，其味甘，其音宫，其物肤，其数五。　　【注　天主生，地主成。土气和平，合天之休美，而化生万物也。土德流于四方，而五化齐修矣。平夷，土之气；柔顺，土之性；高下，土之体。或高或下，咸备其化，土之用也。丰厚满溢，湿土之化也。五方五土，与之同类。安静而化，土之政也。溽蒸，长夏之候也。在天为湿，土之令也。其在脏主脾。畏风者，木乃土之胜也。脾开窍于口。稷，黅谷也。枣色黄而味甘。肉，果实之肉也。倮虫，肉体之虫。牛，土之畜也。脾主肌肉，故其养在肉。[113p]

In the era of preparation for transformation, the air is in harmony with heavenly rest. Virtue flows through the four forms of governance, and the five transformations are cultivated together. Its essence is balanced, its nature is compliant, its applications are high and low, its transformations are abundant, its category is earth, its governance is tranquil, its climate is humid and warm, its laws are moist, and its organ is the spleen. The spleen fears the wind, governs the mouth, relates to grains such as millet, fruits such as jujubes, and the substance of meat, responding to the long summer, to parasitic insects, to livestock such as cattle, exhibiting a yellow color, nourishing meat, and dealing with sickness. Its flavor is sweet, its tone is royal, its material is skin, and its number is five.

[Note: Heavenly dominion brings forth life, while earthly dominion nurtures growth. The air of the earth is harmonious and combines with the beauty of heavenly rest, thereby leading to the emergence of all things. The virtues of the earth flow in all directions, allowing the five transformations to develop together. Balance is the essence of earth; gentleness is its inherent nature; high and low represents its body. Both elevation and depression encompass its transformations, demonstrating the utility of the earth. Abundance and richness signify the humidity associated with the earth's transformation. The five directions correspond to the five types of earth, being of the same category. Tranquility and transformation signify the governance of the earth. Warmth and humidity denote the weather of the long summer. Humidity in the heavens represents the laws of earth, while the spleen governs the organ. The fear of wind corresponds to wood, which overcomes earth. The spleen opens to the mouth. Millet is a type of fine grain. Jujubes are yellow in color and sweet in taste. Meat refers to the flesh of fruits. Parasitic worms are afflictions of the physical body. Cattle are livestock pertaining to the earth. The spleen governs muscles, thus its nourishment is in meat.][113p]

否者，脾病于中，而上下之气不交也。宫音，中土之音。肤，物之肤肉也。五乃土之生数。六元正纪论曰：土常以生也。】　　审平之纪，收而不争，杀而无犯，五化宣明。其气洁，其性刚，其用散落，其化坚敛，其类金，其政劲肃，其候清切，其令燥，其脏肺。肺，其畏热，其主鼻，其谷稻，其果桃，其实壳，其应秋，其虫介，其畜鸡，其色白，其养皮毛，其病咳，其味辛，其音商，其物外坚，其数九。　　【注　金，兵象，金气和平，故收而不争。天地之气，春生秋杀；杀而无犯，不残害于物也。金气清肃，故五化得之，咸有宣明。洁白，金之气也。刚坚，金之性也。万物散落，金之用也。其气收敛，秋之化也。五金之类，与之同类。坚劲肃清，金之政也。清切，秋之候也。在天为燥，金之令也。其脏为肺，肺畏热者，金畏火也。肺开窍在鼻。[114p]

Otherwise, the disease of the spleen resides within, and the energies above and below do not interact. The sound of the palace is the sound of the central land. The skin refers to the flesh of the body. The five correspond to the generative numbers of earth. The "Lun" on the six correct registers states: Earth always generates.

Examining the equilibrium of the registers, it accumulates without contention, kills without offense, and the five transformations are clear and distinct. Its energy is pure, its nature is strong, its function is to disperse, its transformation is to consolidate, it resembles metal, its governance is vigorous and austere, its season is clear-cut, its command is dry, and its organ is the lung. The lung fears heat, governs the nose, corresponds to grains and rice, fruits like peaches, has a hard shell, responds to autumn, relates to insects like pests, is associated with chickens, is white in color, nourishes skin and fur, and has coughing as its ailment, its taste is spicy, its tone is that of "shang," its material is externally firm, and its number is nine.

(Note: Gold symbolizes weaponry, and the energy of metal is balanced, hence it accumulates and does not contend. The energies of heaven and earth bring forth life in spring and kill in autumn; killing without offense means not harming anything. The energy of metal is pure and clear, thus the five transformations obtain clarity. Brightness is the energy of gold. Strength and firmness are the nature of metal. All things disperse in the influence of metal. Its energy consolidates, representing the transformation of autumn. The five kinds of metal belong to this category. Firmness, strength, and clarity signify the governance of metal. Clarity relates to the season of autumn. In heaven, it represents dryness, as per the command of metal. The organ is the lung, which fears heat, hence metal fears fire. The lung opens at the nose.)[114p]

稻乃秋成之谷也。桃色白，而有毛，肺之果也。坚壳之实，介甲之虫，皆感坚刚之气而生也。鸡性善鬬，感肃杀之气也。肺主皮毛，故其养在皮毛。欬者，肺之病也。商主西方之音。辛乃金之味也。其于万物咸如实壳、介虫之外坚。九乃金之成数也。】　　静顺之纪，藏而勿害，治而善下，五化咸整。其气明，其性下，其用沃衍，其化凝坚，其类水，其政流演，其候凝肃，其令寒，其脏肾。肾，其畏湿，其主二阴，其谷豆，其果栗，其实濡，其应冬，其虫鳞，其畜彘，其色黑，其养骨髓，其病厥，其味咸，其音羽，其物濡，其数六。　　【注　水之平运，是谓静顺。夫万物得生长之气而茂盛，水运和平，故虽主藏而不害于物也。水平治而善下，故五气感之，而咸整也。天一生水，故其气高明。水性就下，故性下也。万物凝坚，藏气之化也。[115p]

Rice is the grain that matures in autumn. Peaches are pink and white, and have fuzz; they are the fruits of the lungs. The hard-shelled fruit and the armored insects are all born from the strong and firm energy. Chickens are naturally combative, influenced by the chilling and lethal energy. The lungs govern the skin and fur, so their nourishment lies in the skin and fur. Coughing is an illness of the lungs. The Shang relates to the sound of the west. Sin represents the flavor of metal. All things share a solid essence, just like the hard shells and armored insects. Nine is the number associated with metal.

The tranquility and compliance of the discipline entails concealment without harm, governing in a way that promotes good descent; thus, the five transformations align harmoniously. Its energy is clear, its nature descends, its function is nourishing and expansive, its transformation is concrete and firm, it is akin to water, its regulations flow and evolve, its conditions are still and austere, its enforcement is cold, and its organ is the kidneys. The kidneys fear moisture and govern the two yin, their grains and beans, their fruit and chestnuts, their essence is moist, responding to winter. They contain insects and scales, domesticate pigs, their color is black, they nourish the bones and marrow, their illness is fatigue, their flavor is salty, their sound is like feathers, their substance is moist, and their number is six.

(Note: The commentary mentions that the smooth functioning of water is known as tranquility and compliance. All things prosper by receiving the vital energy for growth, and with the smooth flow of water, it supports concealment without harming anything. With good governance and descent, the five energies respond, hence they are in harmony. Heaven produces water, therefore its energy is lofty and bright. The essence of water seeks to lower, hence its nature descends. The solidity and firmness of all things is derived from the transformation of concealed energy.)[115p]

大地之水，与之同类，流演不竭，水之政也。凝肃，冬之候也。在天为寒水之令也。在脏为肾，肾其畏湿，水畏土也。肾开窍于二阴，故主之。豆乃水之谷也。栗色黑味咸，肾之果也。濡乃实中之有津液者。鳞虫水中之所生。肾主骨髓，故其养在骨髓。肾为生气之原，故病则手足厥冷。羽音属水。六乃水之成数也。】　　故生而勿杀，长而勿罚，化而勿制，收而勿害，藏而勿抑，是谓平气。　　 【注　是以木运之岁，得生气而无金气之肃杀。火运之岁，得长气而无水气之克罚。土运之岁，得化气而无木气之制胜。金运之岁，得收气而无火气之贼害。水运之岁，得藏气而无土气之遏抑。是谓平气之岁也。】　　委和之纪，是谓胜生。生气不政，化气乃扬。长气自平，收令乃早。凉雨时降，风云并兴。草木晚荣，苍干雕落。物秀而实，肤肉内充。[116p]

The waters of the great earth, like kindred spirits, flow and never cease; this is the governance of water. Condensed and solemn is the season of winter. In the heavens, it manifests as the decree of cold water. In the organs, it corresponds to the kidneys, which are sensitive to dampness; water fears earth. The kidneys open to the two yin passages, thus they govern them. The bean is the valley of water. Its dark brown color and salty flavor are the essence of the kidneys. Moisture refers to that which contains liquid within. Scaled creatures arise from water. The kidneys govern bone marrow, hence their nourishment is found in marrow. The kidneys are the source of vitality; thus when one is ill, the hands and feet become cold. The sound of feathers is associated with water. Six represents the number characterized by water.

Therefore, to allow life and not to kill, to nurture and not to punish, to transform and not to constrain, to gather and not to harm, to store and not to repress—this is called harmonious Qi.

Thus, in the years governed by wood, life energy is obtained without the harshness of metal. In the years governed by fire, the nurturing energy flows without the constraints of water. In the years of earth, transformative energy flourishes without the governance of wood. In the years of metal, gathering energy is achieved without the harm of fire. In the years of water, storing energy is possible without the repression of earth. This is called the year of harmonious Qi.

The principles of harmony are said to conquer life. When life energy does not govern, transforming energy is then exalted. Nurturing energy is naturally balanced, and the decree of gathering comes early. Cool rain descends timely, and wind and clouds rise together. Plants and trees flourish late, their leaves withering and falling. Things bloom and bear fruit, with flesh and skin richly filled within.[116p]

其气敛，其用聚，其动软戾拘缓，其发惊骇，其脏肝，其果枣李，其实核壳，其谷稷稻，其味酸辛，其色白苍，其畜犬鸡，其虫毛介，其主雾露凄沧，其声角商，其病摇动注恐，从金化也。少角与判商同；上角与正角同；上商与正商同。其病肢废、痈肿、疮疡，其甘虫，邪伤肝也。上官与正宫同。萧飋肃杀，则炎赫沸腾，眚于三。所谓复也，其主飞蠧蛆雉，乃为雷霆。　　【注　木运不及，是谓委和，则所胜之气，胜其生气。金气胜，则木之生气，不能章其政令矣。木政不章，则土气无畏，而化气乃扬。木衰，则火气不盛，故长气自平。金气盛，故收令乃早也。凉为金化，风为木化，云雨为土化，此以木运不及，故兼有金土之化也。生气不政，故草木晚荣。收令乃早，故苍干刑落。化气与秋成之气专令，是以物秀而实，肤肉内充。[117p]

Its energy is condensed, its function is gathered, its movement is soft, restrained, and slow; it emerges with shock and fear. Its organs are the liver, its fruits are jujubes and plums, its solids are kernels and shells, its grains are millet and rice, its taste is sour and bitter, its color is white and grey, its domesticated animals are dogs and chickens, its insects are hairy and shell-like. Its master is fog and dew, sorrowful and desolate; its sound is the musical notes of Jiao and Shang. Its ailments include shaking, edema, and sores. Sweet insects are harmful to the liver. The upper official corresponds to the central palace. When the winds blow fiercely, there is turmoil, and malignancies occur. The so-called revival is masterful over flying and tunneling insects, resembling thunder. If the Wood element is insufficient, it is said to be harmonious, thus the victorious energy conquers its vitality. If the Metal energy is strong, the life force of Wood cannot establish its governance. If the Wood governance is not established, then the Earth energy has no fear, and the transformative energy rises. When Wood declines, the Fire energy does not flourish, thus the breath stabilizes. Since the Metal energy is abundant, the collection and commands happen early. Coolness represents Metal transformation, wind corresponds to Wood transformation, and clouds and rain represent Earth transformation; this occurs because the Wood operation is insufficient, hence there are aspects of Metal and Earth transformation. When the vital energy does not govern, the grasses and trees flourish late. The collection and commands arrive early; thus, the crust is dry and the fruits fall. The transformative energy, aligned with the autumnal energies, makes it possible for things to flourish and be substantial, nourishing the inner reaches.[117p]

收敛，金之气也。生聚，木之用也。动者，病机动于内；发者，证发于外也；緛，短缩也；戾，了戾也；拘，拘急也；缓，不收也；皆筋之为病。金匮真言曰：东方肝木，其病发惊骇。其脏主肝。其果之枣李、实之核壳、谷之稷稻、味之酸辛、色之苍白、畜之犬鸡、虫之毛介、声之角商，因木运不及，故兼从金土之化也。其主雾露凄沧，金之胜也；其病摇动注恐，肝之病也，此从金化故也。判，半也。少角与判商同者，总谓六丁年，木运不及之岁也。角乃木音，木运不及，故主少角。金兼用事，故半与商金同其化也。上角与正角同者，乃丁巳、丁亥二岁，上见厥阴司天，岁木不及而得司天之助，故与敷和之正角同也。上商与正商同者，乃丁卯、丁酉二岁，上临阳明司天，故曰上商。木运不及，半商同化，而又值阳明司天，则金全用事，与审平之正商相同也。[118p]

Convergence is the essence of metal. Gathering is the function of wood. Movement indicates the internal onset of illness; emergence indicates the external manifestation of symptoms. Binding indicates contraction; obstruction indicates thoroughness; restraint indicates urgency; relaxation indicates non-convergence; these are all ailments of the tendons. The Golden Chamber's true words state: In the east, the liver is wood, and its illness manifests as fright. The organ is the liver. Its fruits are jujubes and plums, its shells are pits, its grains are millet and rice, its flavors are sour and pungent, its colors are pale, its animals are dogs and chickens, its insects are hairy and shelled, its sounds are those of horns and merchants. Due to the inadequacy of wood's growth, it is thus transformed by metal and earth. It governs fog and dew, evoking melancholy, overpowering wood; its illness involves agitation and dread, a liver condition, as it stems from metal's transformation. Judgment means half. The lesser horn and judgment merchant are collectively referred to as the year of the six ding, a year when wood's growth is insufficient. The horn indicates the sound of wood, so when wood's growth is insufficient, it governs the lesser horn. Metal is also engaged; thus half aligns with the merchant's metal transformation. The upper horn and correct horn are the same as the years of ding-si and ding-hai. In those years, it encounters the Jueyin celestial official, and since wood's growth is inadequate, it receives celestial assistance, thus resembling the harmonious correct horn. The upper merchant and correct merchant are identical in the years ding-mao and ding-you. In those years, it meets the Yangming celestial official, hence referred to as the upper merchant. With insufficient wood growth, half of the merchant transforms, while also coinciding with the Yangming celestial official's time, so metal is fully engaged, aligning with the authentic merchant of balanced assessment.[118p]

故其病肢废、痈肿、疮疡，其甘虫，皆金气盛而邪伤肝也。上宫与正宫同者，乃丁丑、丁未二岁，上临太阴司天，故曰上宫，岁木不及，化气乃扬，而又得司天之助，是土得以自专，与备化之纪相同，故上宫与正宫同也。萧飋肃杀，金淫甚也。炎赫沸腾，火来复也。其灾眚，当主于东方之震位。所谓复也，蠧生于木，飞乃火象，言主复者，乃木中所生之火也。蛆乃蝇之子，蛆入灰中，脱化为蝇，蝇喜暖恶寒，昼飞夜伏；雉为离禽，皆火复之气化也。雷之迅者，曰霆，木郁极而火繞之，其气则为雷霆，故《易》曰震为雷。】　　伏明之纪，是谓胜长。长气不宣，藏气反布。收气自政，化令乃衡。寒清数举，暑令乃薄。承化物生，生而不长。成实而稚，遇化已老。阳气屈伏，蛰虫早藏。[119p]

Therefore, ailments manifesting as limb atrophy, sores, and abscesses, along with sweet pests, all arise from a surfeit of metal energy harming the liver. The upper palace shares qualities with the main palace, corresponding to the years of Ding Chou and Ding Wei, when the Tai Yin governs the heavens. Hence, it is called the upper palace. During this time, wood does not flourish; its transformative energy is thus weakened, but it also receives assistance from the heavenly governance. This allows the earth to dominate and aligns with the cycle of transformation, thus making the upper palace akin to the main palace. The autumn winds are harsh and the metal energy is excessive. The heat blazes and boils—this indicates the return of fire. Disasters and misfortunes are associated with the eastern position of Zhen. The term "return" refers to decay arising from wood, and the fire element is represented by flying, indicating the fire generated within wood itself. Maggots are the offspring of flies; when maggots enter ash, they transform into flies. Flies prefer warmth and despise cold, flying by day and hiding at night. The pheasant, as a kind of bird, embodies the transformative energy of fire. The rapidity of thunder is called ting; when wood experiences extreme accumulation, fire wraps around it, producing the energy known as thunder. Thus, the I Ching states that Zhen represents thunder.

The record of hidden brightness is called "victorious growth." When the vital energy is not expressed, it becomes repressed. Collecting energy through regulation leads to balance. The effect of cold clarity is repeated, while heat leads to lightness. Following transformation, life emerges; it grows but does not extend. It becomes substantial yet remains immature, encountering transformation while already aged. The yang energy is restrained, causing hibernating insects to conceal themselves early.[119p]

其气郁，其用暴，其动彰伏变易，其发痛，其脏心，其果栗桃，其实络濡，其谷豆稻，其味苦咸，其色元丹，其畜马彘，其虫羽鳞，其主冰雪霜寒，其声征羽，其病昏惑悲忘，从水化也。少征与少羽同；上商与正商同。邪伤心也。凝惨栗冽，则暴雨霖霪，眚于九。其主骤注，雷霆震惊，沉霒淫雨。　　【注　火运不及则水胜其长，故火之长气不宣，而水之藏气反布。火气伏明，则金无所畏，故收气得自主其政。火不及，则所生之土气不盛，是以化令平衡。[120p]

Its essence is repressed, its use is violent, its movement is evident in change, its release causes pain, its organ is the heart, its fruit is the chestnut and peach, its substance is intertwined and moist, its crops are beans and rice, its taste is bitter and salty, its color is the original cinnabar, its livestock are horses and pigs, its insects have feathers and scales, its master is ice, snow, frost, and cold, its sound is the call of feathers, its illnesses are confusion, sorrow, and forgetfulness, arising from the influence of water. The minor signs are the same as the minor feathers; the upper commerce is the same as the correct commerce. Evil harms the heart. Gathering cold and somber, it brings heavy rain and deluge, afflicting the nine realms. Its master causes sudden downpours, thunder and lightning disturb, and persistent rain falls.

(Note: Fire's absence leads to water prevailing over its growth; thus, the long essence of fire remains unexpressed, while the concealed essence of water becomes manifest. When the essence of fire is subdued, metal has nothing to fear, allowing it to gather its essence and govern independently. Without sufficient fire, the essence of the earth it produces does not thrive, hence balance in transformation is initiated.)[120p]

寒清数举，暑令乃薄，水胜火也。承土之化气平衡，故物得以生长。气不宣则生而不长，故稚小即已成实，遇长夏之化气，即老矣。寒清数举，故阳气屈伏。藏气用事，故蛰虫早藏。其气郁，水制其火也。其用暴，火性欲发也。彰者，火之政令也。彰伏则变易而为寒矣，故其发为痛，盖寒胜则痛也。其脏主心，其果之栗桃、实之络濡、谷之豆稻、味之苦咸、色之元丹、畜之马彘、虫之羽鳞、声之征羽，皆火运不及，故兼从金水之化也。冰雪霜寒，水之变易也。[121p]

The cold is persistently clear, and the heat is gradually diminishing; water prevails over fire. As the transformative energy of the earth achieves balance, living things are able to grow. If the energy is not expressed, growth will stall, and thus even the young that have become real will age when they encounter the transformative energy of long summer. The cold and clarity cause the yang energy to retreat. The hidden energy is utilized, causing hibernating insects to come out early. When the energy is stagnant, water restrains its fire. When it is harshly utilized, the nature of fire desires to manifest. The manifesting is the governance of fire. When the manifest becomes concealed, it transforms and becomes cold, producing pain, as the victory of cold leads to pain. The organ associated with the heart is represented by fruits such as chestnuts and peaches, real items like mulberries, grains like beans and rice, flavors like bitterness and saltiness, colors like cinnabar, livestock like horses and pigs, creatures like insects with feathers and scales, and sounds like musical notes from feathers—all experience inadequate movement of fire and thus are influenced by the transformations of metal and water. Ice, snow, and frost are changes brought by water.[121p]

昏惑悲忘，心神不足，因从水化，而心火受亏也。少征与少羽同者，总谓六癸岁也。征为火音，火运不及，故曰少征。少兼用事，故少征与少羽同其化也。上商与正商同者，乃癸卯、癸酉二岁，上临阳明司天，故曰上商。金无所畏，而又得司天之助，是火运之纪，而行审平之政，故上商之岁与正商之气同也。金水兼胜，邪伤心也。凝惨栗冽，寒之淫甚。暴雨霖霪，土之来复。灾眚当在离位之南方。沉黅，阴云蔽日也。骤注、淫雨，土之变也。雷霆震惊，火郁发也。】　　卑监之纪，是谓减化。化气不令，生政独彰。长气整，雨乃愆。收气平，风寒并兴。草木荣美，秀而不实，成而秕也。[122p]

Confusion and sorrow cloud the mind, leaving it insufficient; thus, influenced by water, the heart's fire is diminished. The concept of "lesser fortune" and "lesser wings" both refer to the six Gui years. "Lesser fortune" represents a fire tone, which lacks vigor; hence it is called lesser fortune. Minor engagements occur, therefore lesser fortune and lesser wings transform similarly. The Upper Shang and the True Shang share the same characteristics; they correspond to the Gui-Mao and Gui-You years, where the heavens favor the sun's brightness, hence named Upper Shang. Metal fears nothing but gains the aid of the heavens, marking the cycle of fire's movement and enforcing fair governance; thus, the years of Upper Shang share the same atmosphere as those of True Shang. The combination of metal and water is victorious, yet causes harm to the heart. The atmosphere is heavy and cold, and the intense cold prevails. Relentless rain brings about the return of earth. Disasters and misfortunes are expected from the south of the Li position. Dull clouds obscure the sun. Sudden downpours and excessive rain signify changes in the earth. Thunder shakes the ground, causing fire to surge forth.

The chronicle of the low overseers is called diminished transformation. The energy of transformation does not command, and governance becomes pronounced. When the energy is harmonized, rain becomes misaligned. When energy is contained and balanced, cold winds arise. Vegetation flourishes and appears beautiful, yet lacks substance; it matures only to produce emptiness.[122p]

其气散，其用静定，其动疡涌分溃痈肿，其发濡滞，其脏脾，其果李栗，其实濡核，其谷豆麻，其味酸甘，其色苍黄，其畜牛犬，其虫倮毛，其主飘怒振发，其声宫角，其病留满否塞，从木化也。少宫与少角同；上宫与正宫同；上角与正角同。其病飧泄，邪伤脾也。振拉飘扬，则苍干散落，其眚四维。其主败折虎狼，清气乃用，生政乃辱。　　【注　土运不及，则化气乃减，木反胜之，是以化气不能施其令，而生政独彰也。木火相生，故长气整。化气不令，故雨乃愆期。[123p]

Its qi is dispersed, its function is calm and stable. Its motion causes sores to burst and swelling to fester. Its manifestations are damp and stagnant. Its organ is the spleen. Its fruits are plums and chestnuts, and its seeds are damp and hard. Its grains are beans and hemp. Its flavor is sour and sweet, and its color is dim yellow. Its livestock includes cattle and dogs. Its insects are hairy and worms. Its primary qualities are drifting, anger, and shaking hair. Its sound is like the palace bell and horn. Its afflictions cause fullness or blockage due to the influence of wood. The lesser palace corresponds with the lesser horn; the upper palace aligns with the true palace; the upper horn matches the true horn. Its illness involves diarrhea and leakage, harmed by evil affecting the spleen. When it shakes and sways, it becomes sparse and falls apart, with its flaws spanning in four directions. Its nature yields to tigers and wolves, and clear qi then is useful, whereas life governance brings disgrace.

(Note: If the earth element is not thriving, then its transformative qi is diminished, and wood overpowers it, thus the transformative qi cannot exercise its command, while the governance of life notably manifests. Wood generates fire, hence the growth of qi is orderly. When the transformative qi does not command, rain becomes overdue.)[123p]

土气不及，故收气自平。木水专令，故风寒并兴。生气彰而长气整，故草木荣美。化气不令，故虽秀而不实、成而秕也。发散，木之气。静定，土之用也。疡痈诸证，逆于肉理，乃生痈肿也。濡滞，水乘土病也。其脏在脾，其果李栗，其实濡核，其谷豆麻，其味酸甘，其色苍黄，其畜牛犬，其虫倮毛，其声宫角，因土运不及，故兼从水木之化也。飘怒振发，木气胜也。留满否塞，脾气伤也。少宫与少角同者，总谓六己岁也。宫为土音，土运不及，是谓少宫。木兼用事，故少宫与少角同其化也。[124p]

The earth's energy is insufficient, thus it self-regulates. The dominance of wood and water causes both wind and cold to arise. The vital energy is pronounced and well-organized, allowing plants to flourish beautifully. When transformative energy is lacking, even when they grow, they may be unproductive and withered. Divergence represents the energy of wood. Tranquility is the function of earth. Conditions like sores and abscesses arise in opposition to the flesh, leading to swelling and inflammation. Humidity and stagnation indicate water's influence over earth-related illnesses. The related organ is the spleen; its fruit includes plums and chestnuts, its essence is moist, its grains include beans and sesame, its flavor is sour and sweet, its color is bluish-yellow, its livestock are cattle and dogs, its parasites are lice and fur, its sound is akin to the gong and the horn. Because earth's energy is insufficient, it also derives from the transformations of water and wood. Fluctuation and anger reflect the dominance of wood's energy. Retention and obstruction indicate damage to the spleen's energy. The lesser palace and lesser horn are both termed the six personal years. The palace represents the sound of earth, and when earth's energy is insufficient, it is called the lesser palace. Wood also plays a role, thus the lesser palace and lesser horn share a transformation.[124p]

上宫与正宫同者，乃已丑、已未二岁，上临太阴湿土司天，故曰上宫。土运不及而得司天之助，是少宫之纪，行备化之气，故与正宫相同也。上角与正角同者，谓己巳、己亥二岁，上临厥阴司天，故曰上角。少宫少角之纪，而角得司天之助，木反独专，故与正角之岁相同也。其病飧泄，邪伤脾也。振拉飘扬，木淫甚也。苍干雕落，金复木也。其灾眚当在四维，乃乾坤艮巽之方也。败折，金之用也。虎狼，西方之兽也。辱，屈也，金气复，而生政始辱。】　　从革之纪，是谓折收。收气乃后，生气乃扬。长化合德，火政乃宣，庶物以蕃。其气扬，其用躁切，其动铿禁、瞀厥，其发咳喘，其脏肺，其果李杏，其实壳络，其谷麻麦，其味苦辛，其色白丹，其畜鸡羊，其虫介羽，宜主明曜炎烁，其声商征，其病嚏咳鼽衄，从火化也。少商与少征同；上商与正商同；上角与正角同。[125p]

The upper palace, being the same as the central palace, pertains to the years of Ji Yin and Ji Wei. It is positioned above the Great Yin, moist earth, and the ruler of heaven, hence it is called the upper palace. When the earthly influence is insufficient and yet it receives the assistance of the ruler of heaven, it denotes the season of the lesser palace, where the transformative energy is complete, thus aligning with the central palace.

The upper corner, being the same as the central corner, pertains to the years of Ji Si and Ji Hai. It lies above the Great Yin and the ruler of heaven, thus it is called the upper corner. This corresponds to the season of the lesser palace and lesser corner, where the corner benefits from the assistance of the ruler of heaven, and wood is independent and dominant, making it similar to the central corner of the year.

Regarding the diseases of food retention and diarrhea, they are due to evils harming the spleen. The shaking, lifting, and fluttering indicate excessive wood. The dullness and decay of the green indicate the transition from metal to wood. The calamities and misfortunes will be in the four directions, corresponding to the areas of Qian, Kun, Gen, and Xun. The destruction is the employment of metal. Tigers and wolves are animals of the west. Humiliation indicates bending; the influence of metal returns, and governance begins to be humiliated.

The period of change is called "folding and collecting." After collection of energy comes the generation of energy, and with it, growth. The lengthy transformation corresponds to merging virtues, and the governance of fire becomes manifest, benefiting all things abundantly. The energy rises, its function becomes agitated, its movements resonate with a clang, leading to confusion, coughing, and wheezing, affecting the lungs. The fruits include plums and apricots, the shells are of the fruit, the grains include hemp and wheat, the flavors are bitter and pungent, the colors are white and reddish, the livestock are chickens and sheep, and the insects are soft-bodied and winged. It pertains to brightness and the intensity of flame. Its sound is clanging and resonant, and its diseases are sneezing, coughing, and nasal bleeding, arising from the transformation of fire.

Shao Shang and Shao Zheng are the same; Shang Shang and Zheng Shang are the same; the upper corner and the central corner are the same.[125p]

邪伤肺也。炎光赫烈，则冰雪霜雹，眚于七。其主鳞伏彘鼠，藏气早至，乃生大寒。　　【注　金运不及，则收政乃折。收气在后，则木无所畏，而生气乃扬，长化合德，故庶物以蕃升扬火之气也。躁切，金之用也。金主声，铿禁者，声不出也。瞀，肺是动病也。厥，气上逆也。欬喘，火刑肺也。其脏主肺。其果之李杏、实之壳络、谷之麻麦、味之苦辛、色之白丹、畜之鸡羊、虫之介羽、声之商征，皆金运不及，而兼木火之化也。明曜炎烁，火之胜也。嚏欬鼽衄，金之病也。少商与少征同者，总谓六乙岁也。商主金音，金运不及，故为少商。火兼用事，故少征同其化也。上商与正商同者，乃乙卯、乙酉二岁，上临阳明司天，故曰上商。金运不及，而得司天之助，则金气平，而不为火胜与审平之气相同，故上商与正商同也。上角与正角同者，乃乙巳、乙亥二岁，上临厥阴司天，故曰上角。[126p]

The邪 (evil) harms the lungs. When the flames and brightness are intense, ice, snow, frost, and hail occur, leading to misfortunes among the seven. Its master lies hidden like a pig or a rat, concealing its essence until the arrival of great cold.

(Note: The influence of metal is not sufficient; therefore, governance falls into disarray. When the energy is delayed, wood becomes unafraid, and vitality rises, leading to a flourishing that culminates in the merging of virtues. Hence, all things flourish due to the rising fire energy. Restlessness is a characteristic of metal. Metal governs sound; clanging and controlling means sound does not emerge. Confusion affects the lungs, causing movement issues. Reversal of breath indicates upsurging energy. Wheezing and coughing are due to fire harming the lungs. The lung's organ is central to this. Its fruits include plums and apricots, while the seeds consist of husks and grain, represented by hemp and wheat, with flavors that are bitter and pungent, and colors of white and reddish. The livestock includes chickens and sheep, while the pests are represented by insects with feathers. The sounds of commerce and taxation all arise from the insufficiency of metal energy, yet they also combine with the transformations of wood and fire. Bright celestial bodies blaze and illuminate, signifying the dominance of fire.

Sneezing, coughing, and nasal bleeding indicate ailments of metal. Shaoshang and Shaozheng are associated with the years of six yǐ (乙). Shang governs metal sound, and its insufficiency transforms into Shaoshang. Fire concurrently engages in actions, hence Shaozheng aligns with its transformation. Above Shang shares qualities with the regular Shang, corresponding to the years yǐ mǔ (乙卯) and yǐ yǒu (乙酉), where it oversees Yangming and the heavens, thus it is called Above Shang. The metal influence is insufficient but receives support from the heavenly realms, resulting in balanced metal energy that does not yield to overpowering fire, and thus Above Shang aligns with regular Shang. Above Jiǎo aligns with regular Jiǎo, corresponding to the years yǐ sǐ (乙巳) and yǐ hài (乙亥), where it oversees Jueyin and the heavens, thus it is called Above Jiǎo.)[126p]

生气乃扬，而又得司天之助，故与正角之岁相同也。水火相胜，故邪伤肺也。炎光赫烈，火淫甚也。冰雪霜雹，水来复也。其灾眚是兑之西方。其主鳞伏彘鼠，皆水之虫兽也。藏气早至，故乃生大寒。】　　涸流之纪，是谓反阳。藏令不举，化气乃昌。长气宣布，蛰虫不藏。土润水泉减，草木条茂，荣秀满盛。其气滞，其用渗泄，其动坚止，其发燥槁，其脏肾，其果枣杏，其实濡肉，其谷黍稷，其味甘咸，其色黅元，其畜彘牛，其虫鳞倮，其主埃郁昏翳，其声羽宫，其病痿厥坚下，从土化也。少羽与少宫同；上宫与正宫同。其病癃闭，邪伤肾也。埃昏骤雨，则振拉摧拔，眚于一。其主毛显狐狢，变化不藏。　　【注　水寒不及，阳反胜之，水之藏令不举，土之化令乃昌。水令不举，则火无所畏，故长气得以宣布。[127p]

The energy of life rises, receiving assistance from the heavens, thus aligning with the year of the proper angle. Water overcomes fire, causing evils that harm the lungs. The blaze is bright and fierce, indicating overwhelming fire. The arrival of ice, snow, frost, and hail signifies the return of water. Their disasters and misfortunes are in the west of Dui. The owner of these is the scaly creatures and the rat, all beings of water. The hidden energy arrives early, hence the birth of great cold. The end of flowing is called the reversal of yang. When hidden energy fails to rise, the transformation of energy flourishes. The long energy spreads forth, and the hibernating insects do not conceal themselves. The earth is moist, and the water springs diminish; the vegetation is lush, flourishing in abundance. When energy is stagnant, it is used for seepage; when it moves, it is firm and still; when it becomes dry, it withers. The organs are the kidneys, the fruits are jujubes and apricots, the grains are millet and rice, their flavors are sweet and salty, their hue is dark and deep. The livestock are pigs and cattle, and the insects are scaly and slimy. Its master is dust, gloom, and obscurity, its voice echoes in the palace of feathers, and its ailments are atrophy and hardening below, resulting from the transformation of earth. The lesser feather corresponds to the lesser palace; the upper palace corresponds to the proper palace. Its ailment of urinary obstruction and retention results from evil harming the kidneys. Dust and darkness with sudden rain lead to shaking and pulling, resulting in calamity as one. Its master is the hair of the fox and the raccoon, manifesting change without concealment.

[Note: The cold water does not reach, while yang triumphs over it. When the hidden energy of water fails to rise, the transformation of earth flourishes. When water does not rise, fire has nothing to fear, hence the long energy is able to spread forth.][127p]

阳热反盛，是以蛰虫不藏。土润水泉减，土胜水也。草木条茂，荣秀满盈，得长化之气也。濡滞，土之气；渗泄，水之用也。其动坚止，土制水，而成积也。其发燥槁，阴液虚也。其脏为肾。其果之枣杏、实之濡肉、谷之黍稷、味之甘咸、色之黅元、畜之彘牛、虫之鳞倮、声之羽宫，因水运不及，故兼从火土之化也。埃郁昏翳，土之胜也。痿厥坚下，肾之病也。此水运不及，而反从土化也。少羽与少宫同者，总谓六辛岁也。羽为水音，水运不及，故曰少羽。土兼用事，故与少宫同化也。上宫与正宫同者，谓辛丑、辛未二岁，上临太阴司天，故曰上宫。土兼用事，而又得司天之助，故少羽之纪，反与正宫之岁相同也。癃闭，邪伤肾，而肾气不化也。埃昏骤雨，士淫甚也。振拉摧拔，木气复也。其灾眚，当在坎之北方。[128p]

The heat of Yang has become excessive, causing hibernating insects not to burrow. The soil is moist, while the water springs diminish; thus, the earth prevails over water. The plants grow lush and full, thriving on the energy of growth. Moisture accumulates, a quality of the earth; infiltration serves the function of water. Its movements are firm and still; the earth controls water, resulting in accumulation. Its dryness and withering indicate a deficiency in the阴液. Its organ is the kidneys. The fruits, such as dates and apricots, the moist flesh, grains like millet and broomcorn, flavors of sweetness and saltiness, deep colors, livestock such as pigs and cattle, scales of insects, and sounds of feathers and palaces—all relate to the insufficient movement of water, thus they are transformed by the influence of fire and earth. Dust accumulates heavily, a sign of the earth's dominance. Weakness and rigidity below signify kidney ailments. Here, the insufficient movement of water reverses into transformation by earth. Those sharing the lesser feathers and palaces are collectively called the years of the six辛. Feathers symbolize the sound of water; since the movement of water is lacking, it is called lesser feathers. The earth takes on functions, hence it assimilates with the lesser palace. The upper palace being the same as the central palace refers to the years of辛丑 and辛未, as it is under the influence of太阴 overseeing the heavens, thus called the upper palace. The earth partially assumes functions and also receives aid from the heavens; hence, the record of lesser feathers corresponds with the years of the central palace. Difficulty in urination, as evil injures the kidneys, results in a failure of kidney energy to transform. Dust clouds and sudden rains indicate great indulgence in the soil. Trembling, pulling, and uprooting restore the vitality of wood. The disasters and misfortunes will manifest in the northern direction of坎.[128p]

毛乃丛聚之象，感春森之气而生，狐狢以毛显而为裘，故其主狐狢。】　　故乘危而行，不速而至。暴虐无德，灾反及之。微者复微，甚者复甚，气之常也。　　 【注　此总结上文，而言五运不及，则所胜之气，乘危而行，不速而至，惟淫胜而无和祥之德，以致子来复雠，灾反及之。胜微则复微，胜甚则复甚，此胜复之常气也。】　　发生之纪，是谓启陈。土疏泄，苍气达。阳和布化，阴气乃随。生气淳化，万物以荣。其化生，其气美，其政散，其令条舒，其动掉眩巅疾，其德鸣靡启坼，其变振拉摧拔，其谷麻稻，其畜鸡犬，其果李桃，其色青黄白，其味酸甘辛，其象春，其经足厥阴少阳，其脏肝脾，其虫毛介，其物中坚外坚，其病怒，太角与上商同。上征则其气逆，其病吐利。不务其德，则收气复，秋气劲切，甚则肃杀，清气大至，草木雕零，邪乃伤肝。[129p]

The fur symbolizes the gathering, born from the feelings of spring's forest air; thus, the fox and weasel display fur, making their master the fox and weasel. Therefore, when riding in danger, one moves slowly to arrive. Cruelty and lack of virtue lead to disasters befalling them. The minor returns to the minor, and the severe returns to the severe; this is the nature of existence.

[Note: This summarizes the previous text, stating that if the five movements do not extend, the prevailing energy moves in danger, arriving slowly. Only excess overcomes, without the virtue of harmony and auspiciousness, leading to offspring coming to seek revenge, with disasters befalling them. Overcoming the minor returns to the minor, and overcoming the severe returns to the severe; this is the regular ebb and flow of energy.]

The record of emergence is called the initiation of arrangement. The earth loosens and leaks, the azure energy permeates. Yang harmony spreads and transforms, while Yin energy follows. Vital energy purifies and cultivates, all things flourish. Its transformations create, its energies are beautiful, its governance spreads, its commands are clear and free, its movements are vibrant and rapid, its virtues resonate, while its changes shake and pull. Its grains are millet and rice, its livestock are chickens and dogs, its fruits are plums and peaches, its colors are blue, yellow, and white, its tastes are sour, sweet, and spicy, its imagery is spring. Its pathways are the Foot, Liver, and Spleen, its insects are hair and shell, its substances are firm inside and outside. Its ailments arise from anger, matching those of the Upper Horn and Upper Commerce. If the upper journey encounters obstructions, its energy becomes reversed, and its ailment manifests as vomiting and diarrhea. If one neglects virtue, then energy recedes. In autumn, the energy becomes vigorous and piercing; in severe cases, it leads to stagnation and death, with the clean energy greatly manifesting, causing plants and trees to decay. Evil then harms the liver.[129p]

　　【注　岁木太过，是谓发生万物之象。土得其制化，故主疏泄。苍气，木气也。厥阴之上，风木治之，是以阳和布化于上，而阴气乃随于下也。生气有余，故万物感之而荣茂芳美。发散，木之政也。条舒，阳和之令也。掉眩巅疾，风气淫于上也。鸣，风木声也。启坼即发陈之义，应春之气也。振拉摧拔，风之变易也。其谷之麻稻、畜之鸡犬、果之李桃、色之青黄白、味之酸甘辛、虫之毛介、物之中坚外坚，因木气太盛，彼此交相承制而生化也。其象应春，其经合于足厥阴肝、足少阳胆，其脏应于肝脾。其病怒，肝气盛也。太角与上商同者，谓气之太过，自有承制，有承制则有生化。如太角之岁木运太过，则金气承之，而所生之谷为稻麻，所生之果为李桃，其畜鸡犬，其虫毛介，皆感木金之气而生化与上商之岁相同也。盖诸壬岁无阳明之上临，故曰太角与上商同。[130p]

The abundant wood element in the year indicates the emergence of all things. Earth receives its transformations and therefore governs dispersal. The azure energy is the energy of wood. Above Jue Yin, wind and wood regulate it, hence Yang and harmony are spread above, while Yin energy follows below. With abundant life force, all things respond and thrive in beauty and fragrance. Dispersing is the governance of wood. Unfurling is the command of Yang and harmony. Dizziness and rapid ascent of wind energy dwell above. The sounds are those of wind and wood. Opening and dividing signify the emergence of spring’s energy. Shaking, pulling, and uprooting represent the changes of wind. The grains like hemp and rice, animals like chickens and dogs, fruits like plums and peaches, colors such as blue, yellow, and white, tastes like sour, sweet, and spicy, insects like furry and shelled, and things that are hard inside and strong outside are all influenced by the excessive wood energy, interconnecting and transforming with each other. Its imagery responds to spring, its channels harmonize with the liver of the foot Jue Yin and the gallbladder of the foot Shao Yang; its organs correspond to the liver and spleen. The illness of anger indicates an excess of liver energy. The great horns (Taijiao) and the Upper Shang being the same indicates that excess energy has a framework; where there is a framework, there is transformation. If the great horns’ year features excessive wood energy, then metal energy supports it, leading to the production of grains like rice and hemp, fruits like plums and peaches, livestock such as chickens and dogs, and insects with fur and shells, all responding to the influence of wood and metal energies, matching the year of Upper Shang. It is said that in all Ren years, there is no presence of Yangming, hence the great horns and Upper Shang are identical.[130p]

如有阳明司天，则当云上商与正角同，言虽无司天之上临，而有自然之承制也。上征者，谓司天上临，少阴君火，少阳相火，乃壬子、壬午、壬寅、壬申四岁，木运有余，而上临火气，子居母上，则其气逆，逆于上则吐，逆于下则利也。木淫太过则金气来复，秋气劲切甚则肃杀，草木雕零，邪乃伤肝。】　　赫曦之纪，是谓蕃茂。阴气内化，阳气外荣。炎暑施化，物得以昌。其化长，其气高，其政动，其令明显，其动炎灼妄扰，其德暄暑郁蒸，其变炎烈沸腾，其谷麦豆，其畜羊彘，其果杏栗，其色赤白元，其味苦辛咸，其象夏，其经手少阴太阳、手厥阴少阳，其脏心肺，其虫羽鳞，其物脉濡，其病笑疟、疮疡血流、狂妄目赤。上羽与正征同。其收齐，其病痓。上征而收，气后也。暴烈其政，藏气乃复，时见凝惨，甚则雨水霜雹切寒，邪伤心也。[131p]

When there is the Yangming influence from above, it is said that the clouds correspond with the commercial and true angles; although there is no direct influence from above, there is the natural governing power. The term "upper summons" refers to the influence from above, with the lesser yin's fire and the lesser yang's fire, specifically in the years of Renzi, Renwu, Renyin, and Renshen, when wood is abundant and fire energy is present above. When the child resides on the mother, the energy becomes reversed; if it reverses above, it expels; if it reverses below, it is beneficial. Excessive wood invites the return of metal energy, and if the autumn energy is intense and harsh, it leads to death; as grass and trees wither, ailments can harm the liver.

The record of the blazing sun is called flourishing. The yin energy is transformed internally, while the yang energy flourishes externally. The heat of summer brings transformation, allowing all things to thrive. Its transformation is long-lasting, its energy heightens, its governance moves, its commands are clear; however, its movements can be fiery, disruptive, and chaotic. Its virtue is that of warmth and humidity, and it transforms into an intense boiling. Its grains include wheat and beans, its livestock are sheep and pigs, its fruits are apricots and chestnuts; its colors are red and white, and its flavors are bitter, spicy, and salty. It symbolizes summer, governs under the lesser yin and greater sun, and the lesser yin and lesser yang. Its organs are the heart and lungs, its pests are those with feathers and scales, its matter is moist and pulse-like, and its diseases include laughter, malaria, ulcers, and blood flow, as well as mania and red eyes. The upper influences align with true summons. Its gathering leads to illness. The upper summons leads to gathering, while the energy follows. Violent governance conceals energy, then recovers; at times, there is a display of gloom, and severe conditions can bring rain, frost, and hail, leading to cold that harms the heart.[131p]

　　【注　岁火太过，是谓赫曦。长气盛，故草木蕃茂。少阴之上，君火主之，故阴气内化。阳气外荣，炎暑施化，司夏令也。物得以昌，受长气也。夏主长，故其化长；火气升，故其气高；火性动，故其政动；火光明，故其令明。炎灼妄扰，手足躁扰也。暄暑郁蒸，气之和祥也。炎烈沸腾，极则变易也。其谷之麦豆、畜之羊彘、果之杏栗、虫之羽鳞、物之脉濡、色之赤白元、味之苦辛咸，交相承制，而生化也。其象应夏，其经合于手少阴心、手太阳小肠、手厥阴心包络、手少阳三焦四经。其脏心者，火脏也。合于肺者，即五脏生成篇之所谓肺之合皮也，其荣毛也，其主心也之义。五脏皆然。《灵枢经》曰：心气实，则笑不休。本经曰：夏伤于暑，秋必痎疟。疮疡血流，狂妄目赤，皆火热之为病也。上羽者。上临太阳寒水司天，乃戊辰、戊戌二岁。[132p]

The passage explains the influence of the summer season and the characteristics of fire energy. It describes how excessive fire leads to a vibrant growth of plants and how heat causes the inward transformation of yin energy. The outward manifestation of yang energy is evident through the bright warmth of summer, which is a time of flourishing and growth.

During this season, the vitality is strong, resulting in high and dynamic energy. The brightness of fire represents clarity in leadership. However, the intensity of heat can also lead to agitation and discomfort. The warmth and humidity contribute to a harmonious atmosphere, while excessive heat can lead to changes and transformations.

Various crops and animals thrive during this time, indicating a rich interplay of elements, including flavors and colors. This reflects the summer's essence and its connection to various meridians associated with the heart and other organs.

The heart is considered the organ of fire, and its health is crucial, correlating with the lungs, as both are connected in the creation of life according to various ancient texts. It is noted that if heart energy is strong, joy and laughter will follow. Conversely, summer's heat can lead to fevers and illnesses in the fall, suggesting that imbalances may manifest later.

Thus, the focus is on the balance of fire energy, its seasonal effects, and its implications for health.[132p]

火运太过，得水制之，则火气已平，故与升明正征之相同也。火气平而金气不受伤，故其收气得与生长化气之相平也。上羽之岁乃太阳司天。痓者，太阳之为病也。上征者，上临君相二火，乃戊子、戊午、戊寅、戊申四岁，火热更甚，故收气乃后，暴列其政，火淫甚也。水气复之，故时见凝惨，甚则雨水冰雹，而心乃受伤也。】　　敦阜之纪，是谓广化。厚德清静，顺长以盈。至阴内实，物化充成。烟埃朦郁，见于厚土。大雨时行，湿气乃用，燥政乃辟。其化圆，其气丰，其政静，其令周备，其动濡积并稸，其德柔润重淖，其变震惊飘骤崩溃，其谷稷麻，其畜牛犬，其果枣李，其色黅元苍，其味甘咸酸，其象长夏，其经足太阴阳明，其脏脾肾，其虫倮毛，其物肌核，其病腹满、四肢不举，大风迅至，邪伤脾也。　　【注　土运太过，是谓敦阜。[133p]

When the fire element is excessive, it must be restrained by water, leading to the pacification of fire energies; thus, it corresponds to the same principle as the rising brightness and proper alignment. When the fire energy is stabilized and the metal energy is unscathed, then the gathering of energy aligns with the nurturing and transforming energies. In the year of the Upper Feather, the sun governs the heavens. The disease of paralysis is attributed to the sun. The Upper Deployment involves the dual fire of the ruler and minister, corresponding to the years of Wuzi, Wuwu, Wuyin, and Wushen when the fire heat is even more intense, causing the gathering of energy to arrive later and resulting in chaotic governance driven by excessive fire. This brings about water energy recovery, hence the appearance of mists and the possibility of rain, ice, and hail, which leads to injury to the heart.

The records of rich abundance are known as broad transformation. With profound virtue and tranquility, it flows smoothly towards fullness. The essence of extreme yin exists within, fostering the growth of things. Smoke and dust are seen hovering over rich earth. Heavy rains occur in due time, with dampness in effect while dry policies are avoided. Its transformation is round and its energy abundant, its governance is calm and its commands thorough. Its movement is moist and accumulative, its virtue gentle, rich, and deep. Its changes cause shock and swift collapse. Its grains include millet and hemp, its livestock comprises cattle and dogs. Its fruits are jujubes and plums, its colors are dark, foundational, and deep green, its tastes are sweet, salty, and sour. Its symbol represents the long summer, its channels connect to the greater yin and yang brightness, its organs are the spleen and kidneys, its pests are worms and lice, its substance is muscle and kernel. Its maladies include abdominal fullness and inability to lift the limbs, with strong winds arriving rapidly; this harms the spleen.

(Note: The excess of earth energy is referred to as rich abundance.)[133p]

土气盛而化气布于四方，故为广化。厚德清静土之体，顺长以盈，火土合化也。太阴之上，湿土主之，故至阴内实，物化充成。盖太阴为阴中之至阴，阴气内实，而后化成万物于外。烟埃朦郁，土之气也。厚土者，见于山陵之间也。大雨时行，湿气上蒸，终为注雨也。辟，避也。夏秋之交，湿土主令，湿气盛，是以秋之燥气乃辟。静者土之政，周备土之令。稸，聚也，湿则濡滞而成积聚也。柔润重淖，土之德。震惊飘骤崩溃，气之变也。其谷之稷麻、畜之牛犬、虫之倮毛、果之枣李、色之黅元苍、味之甘咸酸，皆交相承制而生化也。其经合于足太阴脾、足阳明胃，其脏合于脾肾。其腹满、四肢不举，水湿之为病也。土气太过，风乃复之，则脾反受伤矣。】　　坚成之纪，是谓收引。天气洁，地气明。阳气随，阴治化。燥行其政，物以司成。收气繁布，化洽不终。[134p]

The energy of the earth is abundant and its transformative essence spreads in all directions, thus it is called broad transformation. With thick virtue and the pure essence of earth, it follows nature to be full; this is the fusion of fire and earth. Above the moon, the moist earth governs; hence, in the extreme yin, there is substance, and all things are transformed into existence. The moon represents the utmost yin, where yin energy is substantial, and from this, all things are manifested outwardly. The haze and dust are the essence of the earth. The thick earth is seen between mountains and hills. When heavy rain occurs, the moisture steams upward, ultimately becoming rainfall. "Bi" means to avoid. At the transition from summer to autumn, the moist earth holds sway, leading to an abundance of moisture, hence the dryness of autumn is a result of avoidance. Serenity is the governance of earth, encompassing the regulations of earth's essence. "Ji" means to gather; when moist, it becomes consolidated and accumulates. Softness and moisture are the virtues of the earth. Tremors may cause abrupt collapse, representing changes in energy. The grains such as millet and hemp, livestock like cattle and dogs, vermin with fur, fruits like jujubes and plums, colors like deep black and gray, and tastes like sweet, salty, and sour, all influence and support one another, leading to transformation. Their channels align with the foot taiyin spleen and foot yangming stomach, and their organs correspond to the spleen and kidneys. When the abdomen is full and the limbs are unable to rise, this is due to the illness of excess moisture. When the earth energy is too strong, the wind returns, and the spleen is harmed in turn. The regulations of solid formation are called gathering and attraction. The heavenly energy is pure, and the earthly energy is clear. Yang energy follows, and yin governs transformation. Dryness executes its order, and things are brought to completion. The gathering of energy is prolific, but transformation is not lasting.[134p]

其化成，其气削，其政肃，其令锐切，其动暴折疡疰，其德雾露萧飋，其变肃杀雕零，其谷稻黍，其畜鸡马，其果桃杏，其色白青丹，其味辛酸苦，其象秋，其经手太阴阳明，其脏肺肝，其虫介羽，其物壳络，其病喘喝胸凭仰息。上征与正商同。其生齐，其病咳。政暴变则名木不荣，柔脆焦首，长气斯救，大火流，炎铄且至，蔓将槁，邪伤肺也。　　【注　岁金太过，名曰坚成。秋令主收，是谓收引。天气洁，地气明，金气清也。阳明之上，燥气主之，故阴金治化于上，而阳明之气在下随之。秋主收成，故燥行其政，物以司成，秋主收而长夏主化，收气早布，是以化洽不终。成者秋之化，削者金之气也。肃者金之政，锐切金之令也。暴折筋受其伤，疡疰皮肤之疾也。雾露萧飋，气之祥也。肃杀雕零，气之变也。[135p]

Its transformation is complete, its essence is refined, its governance is solemn, its decrees are sharp and incisive, its movements are violent and prone to injury, its virtue is like fog and dew, its changes are sharp and chilling. Its grains are rice and millet, its livestock are chickens and horses, its fruits are peaches and apricots, its colors are white, blue, and red, its tastes are spicy, sour, and bitter. Its imagery is autumn, its influences are governed by the Taiyin and Yangming, its organs are the lungs and liver, its insects are those with shells and feathers, its materials have shells and membranes, its ailments include coughing and shortness of breath.

Above, it aligns with the Zheng and Shang. Its life is balanced, its illness is coughing. When governance is violent and chaotic, then the name and trees do not flourish; they become soft and brittle, and prolonged conditions can save it, a great fire flows, and intense heat approaches, vines become dry, and evils harm the lungs.

(Note: The year of excessive metal is called "hard and complete." The autumn season primarily governs the harvest, which is called "harvest and pull." The weather is clear, the earth's essence is bright, and the essence of metal is pure. Above Yangming, the dryness governs it; thus, the Yin metal transforms at the top while the Yangming essence follows below. Autumn governs the harvest; hence, dryness dictates its governance, as things are managed in harvest. Autumn mainly governs harvest and late summer governs transformation, where harvesting energy is deployed early, causing transformation to be incomplete. Completion pertains to the transformation of autumn, refinement pertains to the essence of metal. Seriousness pertains to the governance of metal; sharpness is the decree of metal. Violent injury leads to the harm to muscles, while sores are skin diseases. Mist and dew symbolize auspicious air. The sharp and chilling atmosphere represents change.)[135p]

其谷之稻黍、畜之鸡马、果之桃杏、虫之介羽、物之壳络、色之白青丹、味之辛酸苦，交相乘制而生化也。其象应秋，其经合于手太阴肺、手阳明大肠，其脏合于肺肝。其病喘喝、胸凭仰息，金气太盛而肺气实也。上征者，上临少阴少阳二火，乃庚子，庚午、庚寅、庚申四岁。金气太过，得火制之，金气已平，故与审平之正商相同也。金气平，故木之生气不屈，得与四气齐等。其病咳，火伤肺也。肃杀太甚。则草木受伤，长气来复以救之，是以大火西流，而肺反受伤也。】　　流衍之纪，是谓封藏。寒司物化，天气严凝。藏政以布，长令不扬。其化凛，其气坚，其政谧，其令流注，其动漂泄沃涌，其德凝惨寒氛，其变冰雪霜雹，其谷豆稷，其畜彘牛，其果栗枣，其色黑丹黅，其味咸苦甘，其象冬，其经足少阴太阳，其脏肾心，其虫鳞倮，其物濡满，其病胀，上羽而长气不化也。[136p]

In that valley, there are rice and millet, chickens and horses among livestock, peaches and apricots among fruits, and insects such as crickets. The shells of various items, colors of white, green, and red, flavors of spicy, sour, and bitter—all interact, generating and transforming life. Its imagery corresponds to autumn, aligning with the hand's yin of the lung and the hand's yang of the large intestine, harmonizing with the organs of the lung and liver. The ailments present as wheezing and gasping, with the metal energy being too strong and the lung energy being full. The upper correspondences are related to the lesser yin and lesser yang of fire, specifically the years of Gengzi, Gengwu, Gengyin, and Gengshen—four years. When metal energy is excessive, it is regulated by fire; when metal energy is balanced, it aligns with the same importance as proper commerce. With balanced metal energy, the vitality of wood is not stifled, allowing it to synchronize with the four seasonal energies. The ailment manifests as coughing due to fire injuring the lung. The harshness is overwhelming, causing harm to plants. The emergence of vitality seeks to restore it, which is why great fire flowing westward paradoxically injures the lung.

The passage of time is termed sealing and storing. Cold governs the transformation of matter, while the weather is severe and condensed. Storage systems are deployed and remain hidden, with growth not rising. Its transformation is cold, its energy strong, its governance calm, its decrees flowing and entering, its movements drifting and spilling abundantly. Its virtue is thick and cold, its transformations are ice, snow, frost, and hail; with grains of beans and millet, livestock of pigs and cattle, fruits of chestnuts and jujubes, with colors being black, red, and dark, and flavors being salty, bitter, and sweet. Its imagery is winter, corresponding with the foot's lesser yin and greater yang, its organs being the kidney and heart, its insects scaling and creeping. Its substances are moist and full, with the ailment manifesting as bloating, resulting in upward energy and untransformed growth.[136p]

政过则化气大举，而埃昏气交，大雨时降，邪伤肾也。　　【注　水运太过，是谓流衍。冬主闭藏，是谓封藏。寒气司化，故天气严凝。水政以布，故火令不扬。凛冽寒之化，坚凝寒之气，流注水之性。漂泄沃涌，水注之为病也。凝惨寒氛，寒气之和者。冰雪霜雹，寒极而变易也。其谷之豆稷、畜之彘牛、果之栗枣、虫之鳞倮，物之濡满、色之黑丹黅、味之咸苦甘，皆交相承制而生化也。其象应冬，其经合于足少阴肾、足太阳膀胱，其脏合于肾心。其病胀者，水盛而乘土也。上羽者，谓上临太阳，寒水司天，乃丙辰、丙戌二岁。水气太盛，故火气不能施化也。水政太过，则土来复之。埃昏，湿气上蒸也。气交者，湿气上升而为云，天气下降而为雨也。大雨时行，肾反受邪。】　　故曰：不恒其德则所胜来复，政恒其理则所胜同化。此之谓也。[137p]

When governance is excessive, it leads to an overwhelming amount of moisture, and when dust and haze converge, heavy rain falls, which harms the kidneys.

(Note: Water's excess is described as a flowing overflow. Winter represents concealment, known as sealing and storing. Cold air governs transformation, causing the weather to be severe and still. Water orders the distribution, hence fire's influence does not manifest. The piercing cold transforms the stiff, cold air, which flows into the water's nature. The overwhelming flow and discharge of water represent disease. The cold's chilling atmosphere demonstrates the harmonious nature of cold air. Ice, snow, frost, and hail are extreme forms of cold that undergo changes. The grains such as beans and millet, livestock like pigs and cattle, fruits like chestnuts and jujubes, and insects like scales are nourished and bathed, exhibiting dark colors and flavors—each interacting and transforming together. This imagery corresponds to winter, and it relates to the Kidney and Bladder meridians in Traditional Chinese Medicine, aligning with the heart and kidney organs. The disease of swelling occurs when water is abundant and dominates the earth. The rising moisture signifies an ascent to the sun, with cold water governing the heavens, specifically the years of Bing Chen and Bing Xu. The excess of water prevents the transformation by fire. When water governance is excessive, earth will recover from it. Dust and haze arise from wet air rising. The interaction of air means that dampness ascends to form clouds, while falling weather results in rain. When heavy rain occurs, the kidneys are adversely affected.)

Thus it is said: If one does not maintain virtue consistently, what is conquered will return; if governance adheres to principles regularly, what is conquered will integrate harmoniously. This is the essence of it.[137p]

　　 【注　此总结五运之气，如恃强而不恒其德，则所胜之气来复，所谓侮反受邪，寡于畏也。如政令和平，各守其理，则所胜之气同化矣。同化者，即春有鸣条律畅之化，则秋有雾露清凉之政是也。】　　帝曰：天不足西北，左寒而右凉；地不满东南，右热而左温。其故何也？　　 【注　夫天有阴阳，地有阴阳，故论天之五运，而复论地之四方。左寒右凉，右热左温者，从后天之卦象也。盖后天之卦，离南坎北，震东兑西，以天地开辟，而后有四方也。】　　岐伯曰：阴阳之气，高下之理，太少之异也。　　 【注　阴阳之气者，谓四方有寒热之气。高下之形者，谓地土有高下之形。太少者，四象也，因四方之气象，而各有异也。】　　东南方，阳也。阳者其精降于下，故右热而左温。西北方，阴也。阴者其精奉于上，故左寒而右凉。是以地有高下，气有温凉；高者气寒，下者气热。　　 【注　精者，即天一所生之精水也。[138p]

The text summarizes the five elemental energies, stating that if one relies on strength without maintaining virtue, the energies one has overcome will return, which is referred to as "being insulted in retaliation," leading to a diminished sense of fear. However, if governance is peaceful and each adheres to their principles, the energies one has overcome will be assimilated. This assimilation is akin to the transformation in spring when the melodies of nature resonate, resulting in the clear and cool governance of autumn.

The Emperor asks: The heavens are insufficient in the northwest, where it is cold on the left and cool on the right; the earth is insufficient in the southeast, where it is hot on the right and warm on the left. What is the reason for this?

It is noted that as there are yin and yang in heaven, there are also yin and yang on the earth, thus discussing the five movements of heaven and the four directions of the earth. The left being cold and the right cool, as well as the right being hot and the left warm, stem from the hexagrams of the later heaven. The hexagrams of the later heaven are positioned with Li (fire) in the south and Kan (water) in the north, with Zhen (thunder) in the east and Dui (lake) in the west. Because of this arrangement of heaven and earth, the four directions emerge.

Qibo replies: The energies of yin and yang, and the principles of high and low, are merely distinctions of more and less.

The energies of yin and yang refer to the cold and hot energies present in the four directions. The shapes of high and low refer to the earth having elevations and depressions. The terms "more" and "less" refer to the four symbols, which differ according to the energies of the four directions.

The southeast is yang. Yang denotes that its essence descends below, thus it is hot on the right and warm on the left. The northwest is yin. Yin denotes that its essence is revered above, thus it is cold on the left and cool on the right. Consequently, the earth has elevations and depressions, while the energies exhibit warmth and coolness; the higher areas experience cold energies, while the lower areas experience hot energies.

The essence referred to is the refined water born from the unity of heaven.[138p]

天气包乎下，精气通乎天。故阴阳应象论曰，天有精，地有形。盖天为阳而精为阴，阴阳上下之环转也。故精降于下，则阳气升于上，是以右热而左温。阴精奉于上，则阳气藏于下，故左寒而右凉。西北势高，东南地陷，故高者气寒，下者气热。】　　故适寒凉者胀之，温热者疮。下之则胀已，汗之则疮已。此腠理开闭之常，太少之异耳。　　 【注　此论精气之从中而上下升降者也。适生于寒凉之方，阴气上奉，则阳气下藏，故多胀，所谓脏寒生满病也。往处于温热之方，阴气下降，则阳气上升，故多疮，所谓痛痒疮疡，皆属于火也。故下之则阴气降，而阳气自升，故胀者已。汗乃阴液，汗之则阴液升，而阳气自降，故疮者愈。此精气出入于肌腠之间，上下升降，一阖一开，乃自然之常理。[139p]

The weather is influenced by changes, and the essence flows between heaven and earth. Therefore, the theory of the correspondence between yin and yang states that heaven has essence, and earth has form. Heaven represents yang while essence represents yin; the cycle of yin and yang revolves up and down. When essence descends below, yang energy rises above, thus it is hot on the right and warm on the left. When the yin essence is sustained above, yang energy is stored below, hence it is cold on the left and cool on the right. The northwest is high, and the southeast is low; therefore, the high places have cold energy, while the lower places have hot energy.

Thus, those exposed to cold and coolness suffer from swelling, while those in warmth and heat suffer from sores. When one drains excess, swelling subsides; when one sweats, sores heal. This reflects the common principles of the opening and closing of the pores, differing in their nature of abundance and scarcity.

This discussion concerns the rise and fall of essence and energy. In cold and cool environments, the yin energy ascends while yang energy is stored below, leading to much swelling, referred to as "disease due to internal cold." In contrast, when in warm and hot places, yin energy descends while yang energy ascends, resulting in many sores, known to be related to fire, such as painful and itchy sores. Therefore, when one drains, yin energy descends, and yang energy rises, thus resolving swelling. Sweating, being a yin fluid, causes yin fluid to rise and yang energy to descend, leading to the healing of sores. This interplay of essence and energy within the body, their rise and fall, opening and closing, is the natural principle.[139p]

人生于天地气交之中，有四方寒热之异，当从其气而调之，自然苛疾不起。】　　帝曰：其于寿夭何如？岐伯曰：阴精所奉其人寿，阳精所降其人夭。　　 【注　阴精所奉之处，则元气固藏，故多寿；阳精所降之方，则元阳外泄，故多夭。曰阴精，曰阳精，当知地有精而天有精，盖在地为阴，在天则为阳也。】　　帝曰：善！其病也，治之奈何？岐伯曰：西北之气，散而寒之；东南之气，收而温之。所谓同病异治也。　　 【注　西北气寒，寒固于外则热郁于内，故宜散其外寒，凉其内热。东南气热，则阳气外泄里气虚寒，故宜收其元阳，温其中冷。所谓为病虽同，而治法则异也。】　　故曰：气寒气凉，治以寒凉，行水渍之。气温气热，治以温热，强其内守。必同其气，可使平也。假者反之。　　 【注　西北之气寒凉，则人之阳热遏郁于内，故当治以寒凉。行水渍之者，用汤液浸渍以取汗，开其腠理以使阳气通畅。[140p]

In life, one exists amidst the interplay of the energies of heaven and earth, subject to the differences of cold and heat from the four corners.
