Its movement is cold and solemn, its transformation is condensed and eerie; its changes manifest as ice, snow, frost, and hail; its ailment is cold edema.
[Note: The condensation and eeriness, ice, snow, frost, and hail are all transformations of the Great Feather. The ailment of cold edema is due to cold water.]
The Great Feather (End)
The Great Horn (Beginning)
Lesser Zhen: Great Palace
Lesser Commerce
In all these, Lesser Yang governs the affairs of heaven, where Qi transforms and operates primordial principles.
When the heavenly Qi is correct, the earthly Qi is disturbed.
[Note: This clarifies the interactions of the heavenly and earthly Yin and Yang Qi, mutually evoking one another. The so-called mutual interaction between above and below, the Qi interchanges to dominion, thus the cycle of the years is completed.][226p]

如寅申岁主太过，六气皆先天时而至。夫苍黅丹素元之气，化生地之五行；地之五行，上呈天之六气。故曰，寒暑燥湿风火，天之阴阳也，三阴三阳上奉之。是三阴三阳在下，而六气在上也。故少阳之上，火气治之，中见厥阴；厥阴之上，风气治之，中见少阳。天气正者，谓少阳司天，而气化行于气交之中。盖以三阴三阳在下，故虽主司天，而气下行于中也。日阴在泉，故地气扰。下文曰厥阴所至，为挠动为迎，随行令之常也。】　　风乃暴举，木偃沙飞，炎火乃流。
　　 【注　火，风之气也。】[227p]

In the year of Yin and Shen, the Earth’s energies are abundant, and the six atmospheric energies arrive according to the seasonal cycles. The essence of blue, dull red, and pure white originates and evolves into the five elements of the Earth; the five elements of the Earth present themselves as the six atmospheric energies from above. Thus, it is said that cold, heat, dryness, humidity, wind, and fire are the yin and yang of heaven, with three yin and three yang presented from below. Therefore, the three yin and three yang are below, while the six energies are above. Thus, above the Lesser Yang, the fire energy governs, while the Severe Yin is seen within; above the Severe Yin, the wind energy governs, while the Lesser Yang is visible within. When the heavenly energy is correct, it is said that the Lesser Yang directs the heavens, and the energy transforms within the interactions of energies. Given that the three yin and three yang are below, even though they govern the heavens, the energies descend and circulate within. The sun’s shadow is in the spring, hence the Earth’s energy is disturbed. The subsequent text states that where the Severe Yin arrives, it brings disturbance and response, following its constant course. Wind, therefore, rises violently, trees bow, and flames flow.
(Note: Fire is the energy of wind.)[227p]

　　阴行阳化，雨乃时应。
　　 【注　谓厥阴之气上行，而从少阳之化，故雨乃时应。盖少阳所至为火生。终为蒸溽，德化之常也。】　　火木同德，上应荧惑、岁星。
　　【注　上应二星倍明。】
　　其谷丹苍。
　　 【注　感司天在泉之气，而成熟者。】　　其政严，其令扰。
　　 【注　严者，火之政。扰者，风之令也。】　　故风热参布，云物沸腾，太阴横流，寒乃时至，凉雨并起。　　 【注　风热参布者，少阳厥阴之氟，交相参合，而布于气交之中。云物沸腾者，地气上升也。太阴横流，凉雨并起者，蒸溽而为雨也。按厥阴风木，上从司天之化，故太阴湿土从之，即风气下临，黄起土用之义。畏其胜制而从之也。】　　民病寒中，外发疮疡，内为泻满。故圣人遇之，和而不争。往复之作，民病寒热疟，泻，聋，瞑，呕吐，上怫肿，色变。　　 【注　风热之气在外，则寒湿之气在内，故外发疮疡，内为寒中泻满。[228p]

Yin flows upward, yang transforms; rain thus comes at the right time.
[Note: This means the yin energy rises while following the transformation of shao yang, hence rain occurs at the appropriate time. Indeed, where shao yang reaches, fire is born. Ultimately, it leads to steam and humidity, which is the usual transformation of virtues.]
Fire and wood share the same virtue, responding above to the comets and the planets.
[Note: The two stars above respond brightly.]
The grain is reddish and blue.
[Note: This refers to the atmosphere responding to the heavenly control, resulting in the maturing of crops.]
The government is strict, and the edicts are intrusive.
[Note: Strictness refers to the governance of fire; intrusiveness refers to the edicts of wind.]
Thus, wind and heat interweave, clouds billow and boil, the tai yin flows fiercely, and cold arrives on time, with cool rain occurring simultaneously.
[Note: The interplay of wind and heat refers to the intermingling of shao yang and jue yin, which combines and spreads through the atmosphere. The boiling clouds indicate that the earthly energy rises. The fierce flow of tai yin and simultaneous cool rain signifies that steam and humidity manifest as rain. According to the transformation of jue yin wind and wood, it ascends from celestial changes, so tai yin moist earth follows it; thus, the wind comes down, representing the meaning of yellowing soil. It fears being overwhelmed yet follows it.]
The people suffer from internal cold, externally manifesting sores and ulcers, while internally they have diarrhea and fullness. Therefore, the sage encounters this with harmony and without contention. As cycles unfold, the people's ailments include chills, fevers, intermittent fevers, diarrhea, deafness, dizziness, vomiting, swelling, and changes in complexion.
[Note: When the winds and heat are external, the cold and humid energies are internal, causing external sores and internal cold leading to fullness.][228p]

圣人遇此之候，和其寒热，而不使外内交争，往复出入也。如外内往复交作，则为寒热之疟，泻聋瞑呕吐者，风热之气乘于内也。上怫肿色变者，寒湿之气乘于外也。】　　初之气，地气迁，风胜乃摇，寒乃去，候乃大温。草木早荣，寒来不杀，温病乃起。其病气怫于上，血溢目赤，咳逆头痛，血崩胁满，肤腠中疮。　　 【注　初之间气乃少阴君火，主气乃厥阴风木，是以风摇候温，草木得生长之气而早荣也。少阳司天，又值君火主气，故虽有时气之寒来而不能杀，二火之温热也。血溢、目赤、咳逆、肤疮等证，皆风火之为病也。】　　二之气，火反郁，白埃四起，云趋雨府，风不胜湿，雨乃零，民乃康。[229p]

When the sage encounters this period, they harmonize the cold and heat, preventing external and internal conflicts from arising. If external and internal forces clash, it leads to maladies of cold and heat, such as diarrhea, deafness, dizziness, and vomiting, where the energy of wind and heat prevails within. Swellings and color changes signify that cold and dampness dominate from without.

In the initial phase, the energy of the earth moves, the wind prevails and shakes, the cold departs, and the season turns warm. Vegetation flourishes early; the cold does not kill, and thus warmth-related illnesses arise. Symptoms of illness include upward blockage, blood overflowing leading to red eyes, coughing with reverse flow, headaches, blood loss, fullness in the sides, and skin sores.

In this initial period, the energy aligns with the Lesser Yin's fire, while the governing energy corresponds with the Severe Yin's wind and wood; hence the wind stirs and the temperature rises, allowing plants to absorb the life-giving energy early. The Lesser Yang governs the heavens, paired with the fire of the ruler, which means that despite the arrival of seasonal cold, it does not kill, due to the warmth of both fires. Symptoms like blood overflow, red eyes, coughing, and skin sores showcase the afflictions caused by wind and fire.

In the second phase, fire reacts with pent-up energy, white dust rises everywhere, clouds gather, and rain is anticipated. If the wind cannot overcome the moisture, the rain falls, and the people find relief.[229p]

其病热郁于上，咳逆呕吐疮发于中，胸胁不利，头痛身热，昏愦脓疮。　　 【注　二之客气乃太阴湿土，故司天之火气反郁。白埃四起，云趋雨府，皆湿土之气化也。厥阴风气，虽上从少阳，而不能胜其雨湿。风火气盛得阴湿以和之，故民乃康。其有灾眚，则病热郁、呕吐、昏愦、脓疮诸证，皆因阴湿疑于外，而火热郁于内也。】　　三之气，天政布，炎暑至，少阳临上，雨乃涯。民病热中，聋瞑、血溢、肿疮、咳呕、鼽衄、渴、嚏欠、喉痹、目赤、善暴死。　　 【注　司天之气上临于三气，故天政布。主时之气，亦属少阳，故炎暑至。雨乃涯者，太阴横流也。民病热中，血溢、鼽衄、嚏欠诸证，感风火之气也。[230p]

The illness manifests as heat accumulating in the upper body, with symptoms of cough, nausea, and sores arising in the middle; there is discomfort in the chest and sides, headaches, fever, confusion, and pus-filled sores.

[Note: The guest qi of the second phase is the damp earth of the Taiyin, thus the fire energy in charge of heaven becomes repressed. White dust rises, clouds move towards the rain chamber, all are transformations of the damp earth qi. The wind qi of the Jueyin, while ascending with the Shaoyang, cannot overcome the rainy dampness. When wind and fire energies are strong and harmonized by Yin dampness, the people are well. If there are calamities, then symptoms of repressed heat, vomiting, confusion, and pus-filled sores arise, caused by the external Yin dampness and internal repressed fire heat.]

In the third phase, the heavenly influence is distributed, the scorching heat arrives, the Shaoyang approaches the upper, and rain is about to come. The people suffer from internal heat illnesses, with symptoms of deafness and blindness, bleeding, swollen sores, cough, vomiting, nasal hemorrhage, thirst, sneezing, throat obstruction, red eyes, and sudden death.

[Note: The heavenly qi approaches in the third phase, thus the heavenly influence is distributed. The seasonal qi also belongs to Shaoyang, hence the arrival of scorching heat. When it is about to rain, the Taiyin flows horizontally. The people’s internal heat illnesses, symptoms of bleeding, and sneezing are caused by the influence of wind and fire qi.][230p]

二火相交，风热并至，故善暴死。】　　四之气，凉乃至，炎暑间化，白露降，民气和平。其病满身重。　　 【注　加临间气，乃阳明清凉之气，故凉乃至，白露降。少阳之火与风热之气，交于气交之中，故炎暑间化。风热主岁，而遇此清凉，故民气和平。其病满身重者，感主时湿土之气也。】　　五之气，阳乃去，寒乃来，雨乃降，气门乃闭，刚木早雕。民避寒邪，君子周密。　　 【注　五之间气，乃太阳寒水，故阳热去，而寒乃来。以秋冬之交，而行闭藏之冬令，故气门乃闭，宜周密以避寒邪。】　　终之气，地气正，风乃至，万物反生，霜雾以行。其病关闭不禁，心痛，阳气不藏而咳。　　 【注　厥阴风木主终气，故风乃至。[231p]

When two fires intersect and wind warmth arrives together, it leads to sudden deaths. The fourth phase brings coolness, as the heat of summer transforms, and white dew descends, resulting in contentment among the people. This condition manifests as a heavy illness throughout the body.

(Note: The addition of timely cold air corresponds to the clear and cool energy of Yangming, hence the arrival of coolness and the descent of white dew. The heat of lesser Yang fire mingles with the warm wind, prompting this seasonal transformation. Since warm winds dominate the year, encountering this coolness brings peace among the people. The heavy illness throughout the body is attributed to the damp earth energy of the season.)

In the fifth phase, the Yang energy departs, cold arrives, rain falls, the gates of energy close, and the tough wood withers early. People avoid cold evils, and the wise individual takes precautions.

(Note: The energy of the fifth phase consists of the cold water of the sun, hence Yang heat departs as cold is near. With the transition between autumn and winter, this leads to the closing and storing characteristic of winter, hence the gates of energy are closed and precautions must be taken to ward off cold evils.)

In the final phase, the earth's energy is upright, the wind arrives, all things regenerate, and frost and fog occur. The illnesses manifest as closed pathways with restriction, causing heart pain, and Yang energy failing to retain results in coughing.

(Note: The “end” energy is governed by the wind of Jueyin wood, hence the wind arrives.)[231p]

地气正者，厥阴从中见少阳之化也。万物遇生气而反生，地气反上升。而霜雾以行以闭藏之时，而反行发生之令。故其病关闭不禁、心痛者，肾气上乘于心也。夫肺主气，而肾为生气之原，故肾为本，肺为末。阳气至冬而归藏于肾脏，今反上乘于肺，故咳。】　　抑其运气，赞所不胜。必折其郁气，先取化源。暴过不生，苛疾不起。　　 【注　运气太过，故当抑之。所不胜者，如壬年角运太过，则土气不胜；戊年火运太过，则金气不胜。故宜抑其太过，赞助其所不胜。折其郁气者，如庚寅庚申岁，少阳司天，则商运受郁矣；甲寅甲申岁，厥阴在泉，则宫运受郁矣。[232p]

The essence of the Earth, when it is upright, reveals the transformation of Shaoyang from within. All things encounter the vital energy and begin to thrive; the Earth’s energy then rises up. During times of frost and mist, it acts and conceals, thus commanding the process of emergence. Therefore, those who suffer from blockages and heart pain have kidney energy ascending to the heart. The lungs govern Qi, while the kidneys are the source of vitality; thus, the kidneys are foundational, and the lungs are secondary. Yang energy, in winter, returns to the kidneys, but if it instead ascends to the lungs, it leads to cough.

In cases of excessive energy, one must suppress it. It is essential to break the stagnation and first address the source of transformation. Intense excess does not bring forth life, and harsh illnesses do not arise.

When the energy is too much, it must be suppressed. What cannot withstand it, like during the Ren year when the wood energy is excessive, leads to the Earth energy being overwhelmed; in the Wu year, when the fire energy is excessive, the metal energy becomes overwhelmed. Therefore, it is appropriate to suppress the overabundance and support what cannot be overwhelmed. Breaking the stagnant energy occurs, for example, in the Geng Yin and Geng Shen years, when Shaoyang governs the heavens, thus the commerce energy suffers stagnation; in the Jia Yin and Jia Shen years, where Jueyin resides in the spring, the palace energy suffers stagnation.[232p]

是当折其致郁之气，先取五运之化源，折抑其太过，赞助其不胜。是以暴过不生，苛疾不起。暴者，谓太宫太商之运气主太过，而反受其郁，故其过暴。暴甚曰苛。】　　故岁宜咸宜辛宜酸，渗之世之渍之发之。　　 【注　宜咸以制少阳之火，宜辛以胜风木之邪。厥阴从少阳之火化，是子泻其母气，故宜用酸以补之。渍者，上古用汤液浸渍以取汗。渗之泻之，以清火热之在中；渍之发之，以散风邪之外袭。】　　观气寒温，以调其过。同风热者多寒化。异风热者少寒化。　　 【注　寒温谓五运之寒温也。如太角、太征之岁，运气与司天在泉之风热相同者，多用寒凉以清之。如太宫、太商、太羽之岁，运气与司天在泉之气异者则少之。[233p]

To address the excess of stagnant energy, one should first draw from the source of the Five Movements, moderating its extremes and supporting its insufficiency. Hence, excessive conditions do not arise, and harsh ailments do not emerge. The term "excessive" refers to the energy of the Tai Gong and Tai Shang, which governs excess and in turn experiences stagnation, resulting in its severity. Extreme excess is called "harsh".

Therefore, in a year, one should favor salty,辛, and sour elements to mitigate the detrimental effects of the environment.

Salty is appropriate to control the fire of the lesser yang, and辛 helps to overcome the evil of the wind and wood. The Jue Yin follows the transformation of the lesser yang fire, thus it drains the mother’s energy, making the use of sour necessary for replenishment. The term "soak" refers to the ancient practice of using liquids to extract sweat. "Seep" refers to draining in order to clear the internal heat; "soak" is for dispersing external wind evils.

Observe the cold and warm air to adjust the excess. Similar winds with heat tend to undergo more cold transformation, while dissimilar wind heats experience less cold transformation.

The cold and warm refer to the temperatures of the Five Movements. In years of Tai Jiao or Tai Zheng, when the atmospheric conditions resonate with the wind and heat at the springs, one often uses cooler elements for cleansing. In the years of Tai Gong, Tai Shang, and Tai Yu, when the energies differ from those at the springs, less cooling is needed.[233p]

食药同法。】　　用热远热，用温远温，用寒远寒，用凉远凉。食宜同法。此其道也。有假者反之，反是者，病之阶也。　　 【注　盖言岁运寒热之药，食当远此司天在泉。远者，勿犯也。】　　帝曰：善！太阴之政奈何？岐伯曰：丑未之纪也，　　太阴　少角　太阳　清热胜复同　同正宫　丁丑　丁未　其运风清热。　　 【注　少角主木运不及，故清气胜之。有胜必有复，故热以复之。清热胜复之气，与木运同其化。同正宫者，委和之纪，上宫与正宫同也。其运风清热者，风乃运气、清乃胜气、热乃复气，三气同其运也。按太过之运言病，不及之运不言病，盖太过者暴，不及者徐。[234p]

Food and medicine follow the same principles. Use hot to counteract heat, use warm to counteract warmth, use cold to counteract cold, use cool to counteract cool. Food should adhere to the same principles. This is the way of it. Those who deviate from this are in a state of illness.

The Emperor said: Excellent! What about the governance of the Taiyin? Qibo replied: It corresponds to the intervals of Chou and Wei. Taiyin, Shaojiao, and Taiyang: Clear heat overcomes recovery, all are in harmony with the right palace. Ding Chou and Ding Wei; their movement is of wind and clear heat.

Notice: Shaojiao governs the wood element, thus clear energy overcomes it. Where there is overcoming, there is recovery, hence heat induces recovery. The clear heat overcoming recovery energy is in harmony with the wood element's transformation. Those in harmony with the right palace are the records of regulation; the upper palace and the right palace are in unity. The movement of wind and clear heat signifies that wind is the moving energy, clear is the overcoming energy, and heat is the recovering energy; all three energies are in harmony in their movement.

It is noted that one speaks of illness in terms of excessive movement, but does not speak of illness regarding insufficient movement, for excessive movement is abrupt, while insufficient movement is gradual.[234p]

】　　少角 【初正】 　太征　少宫　太商　少羽 【终】　　太阴　少征　太阳　寒雨胜复同　癸丑　癸未，其运热寒雨。　　 【注　火运不及，寒反胜之，土雨来复，故寒雨胜复同。】　　少征　太宫　少商　太羽 【终】 　太角 【初】　　太阴　少宫　太阳　风清胜复同　同正宫　己丑太乙天符　己未太乙天符　其运雨风清。　　 【注　同正宫者，上宫与正宫同也。土运临四季，是为岁会；土运之岁，上见太阴，是为天符；天符合岁会，是为太乙天符。】　　少宫　太商　少羽 【终】 　少角 【初】 　太征　　太阴　少商　太阳　热寒胜复同　乙丑　乙未　其运凉热寒。　　 【注　疏义同前。】[235p]

Lesser Horn, Initial Zheng, Greater Zheng, Lesser Palace, Greater Commerce, Lesser Feather, End, Greater Yin, Lesser Zheng, Sun, Cold Rain Dominates, Together, Gui Chou, Gui Wei, its movement is Heat, Cold, Rain.

[Note: The fire movement is insufficient, hence cold predominates. The earth's rain comes back, thus cold rain dominates and is aligned. ]

Lesser Zheng, Greater Palace, Lesser Commerce, Greater Feather, End, Greater Horn, Initial, Greater Yin, Lesser Palace, Sun, Wind and Clarity Dominates, Together, Same Zheng Palace, Ji Chou, Tai Yi Celestial Talisman, Ji Wei, Tai Yi Celestial Talisman, its movement is Rain, Wind, Clarity.

[Note: Those in the same Zheng Palace refer to the Upper Palace being the same as the Zheng Palace. The earth movement influences the four seasons, which is the year meeting; in the year of earth movement, when observing Greater Yin, it is the Celestial Talisman; the Celestial Talisman aligns with the Year Meeting, thus it is the Tai Yi Celestial Talisman.]

Lesser Palace, Greater Commerce, Lesser Feather, End, Lesser Horn, Initial, Greater Zheng, Greater Yin, Lesser Commerce, Sun, Heat and Cold Dominates, Together, Yi Chou, Yi Wei, its movement is Cool, Heat, Cold.

[Note: The annotations are consistent with the previous explanation.][235p]

　　少商　太羽 【终】 　太角 【初】 　少征　太宫　　太阴　少羽　太阳　雨风胜复同　同正宫　辛丑　辛未　其运寒雨风。　　 【注　同正宫者，涸流之纪，上宫与正宫同也。】　　少羽 【终】 　少角 【初】 　太征　少宫　太商　　凡此太阴司天之政，气化运行后天。阴专其政，阳气退避，大风时起，天气下降，地气上腾，原野昏霿，白埃四起，云奔南极，寒雨数至，物成于差夏。民病寒湿，腹满，身(月真)愤，胕肿，痞逆，寒厥拘急。[236p]

Translation:

Shao Shang, Tai Yu [End]
Tai Jiao [Start]
Shao Zheng, Tai Gong, Tai Yin, Shao Yu, Tai Yang
Rain and wind triumph over each other, both are in the same palace, Xin Chou, Xin Wei, their movement is cold rain and wind.
[Note: The same palace refers to the situation of diminished flow, where the upper palace and the central palace are the same.]
Shao Yu [End]
Shao Jiao [Start]
Tai Zheng, Shao Gong, Tai Shang
Overall, the Tai Yin governs the affairs of Heaven, and the transformation of qi operates in the later heaven. The Yin exclusively governs the affairs, the Yang qi retreats and hides, the great wind occasionally rises, the weather descends, the earth qi ascends, the fields are dim and hazy, the white dust rises everywhere, the clouds race toward the southern pole, cold rain arrives frequently, and things mature in varying summer conditions. The people suffer from cold and dampness, bloating, bodily irritations, swelling, stagnation, and cold-induced urgency.[236p]

湿寒合德，黄黑埃昏，流行气交，上应镇星、辰星。其政肃，其令寂，宜谷黅元。　　【注　太阴司天，寒水在泉，故阴专其政。阳气退避，土令不及，风反胜之。天地之寒湿气交，故原野昏霿，寒雨数至也。差夏，长夏之时，秋之交也。民病腹满诸证，皆感寒湿之气而成。寒湿合德，故黄黑埃昏，流行气交，上应辰镇二星明耀。肃者，土之政。寂者，水之令。黅元之谷，感司天在泉之气而成。】　　故阴凝于上，寒积于下。寒水胜火，则为冰雹。阳光不治，杀气乃行。　　 【注　太阴之湿气凝于上，太阳之寒气积于下，寒水胜火，则为冰雹。[237p]

Moist cold combines with virtue, yellow and black dust darkens, the circulating qi interacts, responding upwards to the Zheng and Chen stars. The governance is solemn, the decrees quiet, suitable for the valley grain.

(Note: The moon governs the heavens; cold water is at the spring, hence the yin predominates in governance. The yang retreats, and the soil's command does not reach, while the wind overcomes it. The cold and wet qi of heaven and earth interact, thus the fields are shrouded in mist; cold rains arrive frequently. This differs from summer; it is the time of late summer, the beginning of autumn. The people suffer from abdominal fullness and other symptoms, all caused by the cold and wet qi. The combination of cold and wet yields yellow and black dust in darkness, and the circulating qi interacts, responding upwards to the bright Zheng and Chen stars. "Solemn" pertains to the governance of the earth. "Quiet" refers to the decrees of water. The valley grain arises from the influence of the qi governed by the heavens in the spring.)

Thus, the yin condenses above, while cold accumulates below. When cold water overcomes fire, it becomes hail. If the sunlight does not regulate, the killing qi will manifest.

(Note: The moist qi of the moon condenses above, while the cold qi of the sun accumulates below; when cold water overcomes fire, it results in hail.)[237p]

即所为火郁之发，山川冰雪是也。阳气在上，为阴凝所胜，则肃杀之气乃行，此言上下阴阳之气也。】　　故有余宜高，不及宜下；有余宜晚，不及宜早。土之利，气之化也，民气亦从之，间谷命其太也。　　 【注　此言五方之地土，各有高下厚薄之不同。故岁气有余，地土宜高厚。岁气不及地土宜卑下。盖太过之气宜缓，不及之气宜先。地土高厚，气缓于出；地之下者，气易于升也。气有余，宜至之迟；气不及，宜至之早。此地利之有高下，气至之有早晏，而民气亦从之。间谷命其太，注见前。[238p]

The fire’s emergence is akin to the flourishing of vegetation; mountains and rivers covered in ice and snow represent this. When the yang energy is positioned above and is overcome by the yin, the chilling and killing energy arises. This illustrates the interplay of the upper and lower forces of yin and yang.

Thus, when there is an abundance, it is appropriate to rise; when there is deficiency, it is suitable to descend. The benefit of the earth lies in the transformation of its energy, which the populace adapts to, thereby influencing their fate.

This refers to the varying elevations and thickness of the soils in the five regions. Therefore, when seasonal energy is abundant, the soil should be high and thick; when the seasonal energy is lacking, the soil should be low and thin. An excess of energy should be moderated, while a deficiency should be prioritized. High and thick soil allows energy to be more gradual in emergence; lower soil permits easier ascension of energy. When energy is abundant, it should arrive more slowly; when deficient, it should arrive more quickly. This reflects the geographical advantages of high and low lands, the timing of energy arrivals, and the corresponding behavior of the populace, which is governed by this dynamic.[238p]

】　　初之气，地气迁，寒乃去，春气正，风乃来，生布万物以荣，民气条舒。风湿相薄，雨乃后。民病血溢，筋络拘强，关节不利，身重筋痿。　　 【注　初之主客皆风气所司，故岁前之地气迁，冬令之寒乃去。而春气正，风乃来，生荣万物，民气条舒。主客之气，与司天之气相薄，故雨乃后至也。民病血溢、筋痿诸证，皆感风湿之气所致。】　　二之气，大火正，物承化，民乃和。其病温厉大行，远近咸若。湿蒸相薄，雨乃时降。　　 【注　二之主客乃君相二火，故大火盛。火土合德，故物承化民乃和。[239p]

In the beginning of the season, the earth's qi shifts, the chill departs, the spring qi is established, the wind arrives, nurturing all things to thrive, and the people feel at ease. The interaction of wind and dampness leads to rain arriving later. The people suffer from symptoms of blood overflow, stiff muscles, tense tendons, obstructed joints, heaviness in the body, and muscle atrophy.

(Note: The initial influence of the qi for both rulers and subjects is controlled by wind qi; hence, the earth's qi shifts before the year starts, and the winter chill departs. When the spring qi is proper, the winds come, fostering the growth of all things, and the people's spirits are at ease. The interplay of the ruling and subject qi with the atmospheric qi delays the arrival of rain. The illnesses such as blood overflow and muscle atrophy are all due to the influence of wind and damp qi.)

In the second season, the great fire is proper, and things transform; thus, the people are harmonious. The illnesses arise from severe warmth and spread across the land. With dampness steaming and mingling, rain falls at the appropriate times.

(Note: The influences of the rulers and subjects here are represented by the two fires; hence, the great fire is strong. The combination of fire and earth brings forth transformation, leading to harmony among the people.)[239p]

湿热气盛，是以温厉大行。土气周备于四方，故远近咸若。】　　三之气，天政布，湿气降，地气腾，雨乃时降，寒乃随之。感于寒湿，则民病身重，胕肿，胸腹满。　　 【注　司天之气临于三气，寒湿之气行于气交。】　　四之气，畏火临，溽蒸化，地气腾，天气否隔。寒风晓暮，蒸热相薄，草木凝烟，湿化不流，则白露阴布，以成秋令。民病腠理热，血暴溢，疟，心腹满热，胪胀，甚则胕肿。　　 【注　四之客气，乃少阳相火。寒水在泉，故畏火之加临。[240p]

The prevalence of damp heat leads to the harshness of warmth. The earth's energy is abundant in all directions, thus both near and far experience it uniformly. In the third atmospheric phase, heavenly governance distributes, dampness descends, earth's energy rises, and rain falls timely, followed by cold. When affected by cold dampness, the people suffer from heavy bodies, swelling, and fullness in the chest and abdomen.

Note: The air from the heavens influences the three energies; the cold dampness is active in the interplay of energies.

In the fourth phase, there is a fear of fire's arrival, steam transforms, the earth's energy rises, and the heavenly energy is separated. The cold wind morning and evening, steam and heat suppress one another; plants and trees are shrouded in mist, dampness condenses without flowing, resulting in white dew and signaling the arrival of autumn. People suffer from heat in the pores, overflowing blood, fevers, and fullness and heat in the heart and abdomen, leading to severe swelling.

Note: The guest energy of the fourth phase aligns with the lesser yang fire. Cold water in springs thus fears the encroachment of fire.[240p]

四之主气，乃太阴湿土，湿热相合，则溽蒸化，而地气上腾。阴湿之气与火气不相合，是以天气痞隔，湿化不流于下，则白露阴布，以成秋令。寒风，太阳寒水之气也。民病满胀等证，乃寒湿热三气杂至合而为病也。】　　五之气，惨令已进，寒露下，霜乃早降，草木黄落，寒气及体，君子周密，民病皮腠。　　 【注　五气之主客，皆阳明清凉之气。故其候寒冷，收藏之令早行，故君子周密。阳明之气主肌，故病在皮腠。】　　终之气，寒大举，湿大化，霜乃积，阴乃凝，水坚冰，阳光不治。[241p]

The energy of the fourth phase is governed by the Great Yin, which represents moist and loamy earth. When dampness and heat combine, it creates a steamy vapor that rises from the earth. The damp and cold energy does not integrate well with fire energy, causing a blockage in the weather's flow. As a result, dampness does not descend; instead, the white dew appears, signaling the arrival of autumn. The cold wind represents the frigid energy of the sun and water. The people suffer from fullness and other related ailments, which arise from the mingling of cold, damp, and heat energies, manifesting as illness.

The energy of the fifth phase is now surging. The cold dew has descended, and frost falls early. The vegetation turns yellow and withers, while the cold energy affects the body. A gentleman must be meticulous; the people suffer from skin conditions.

(Note: The energies of the fifth phase, whether master or servant, are all the clear and cooling energies of Yangming. Thus, the signs of cold and the command to store up energy arise early, prompting the gentleman to exercise caution. The Yangming energy governs the muscles, which explains the sickness affecting the skin.)

In the final phase, the cold becomes prominent, dampness intensifies, frost accumulates, and Yin becomes solidified. Water hardens into ice, and sunlight fails to correct this.[241p]

感于寒，则病人关节禁固，腰脽痛，寒湿持于气交而为疾也。　　 【注　终之主客，乃在泉寒水之气，故寒大举。寒湿之气，上下相交，故湿大化。霜积阴凝，湿之化也；冰坚阳伏，寒之令也。肾为冬藏而主骨，关节禁固，骨节不利也。腰脽者，肾之腑也。寒湿持于气交，谓天地之气上下相持，人在气交之中，而为病也。】　　必折其郁气而取化源，益其岁气无使邪胜。　　 【注　岁运不及，故益之。邪气，即己所不胜之气也。】　　食岁谷以全其真，食间谷以保其精。　　 【注　真精者，乃天一所生之真元，即精与气耳。[242p]

When affected by the cold, a person experiences joint stiffness and lumbar pain; the cold and dampness invade the interaction of the qi, leading to illness. The root cause is the coldness of the water, which is why the cold is severe. The interaction between the cold and damp qi, both above and below, causes great transformation of dampness. Frost accumulates and solidifies, transforming the dampness; ice grows rigid and suppresses the yang, enforcing the cold. The kidneys store during winter and govern the bones; hence, the joints become stiff and the movements of the bones are restricted. The lumbar region pertains to the kidneys. The cold and damp hold the qi in intersection, which refers to the balance of the qi between heaven and earth; people become ill within this interaction of qi.

One must break through the accumulated qi to find the source of transformation, enhancing the seasonal qi to prevent the evil from prevailing. The seasonal energies are insufficient, hence the need for enhancement. The evil qi refers to the qi that one cannot overcome.

Consume grains of the season to maintain one's essence, and eat intermediate grains to preserve one's vital energy. The essence refers to the true origin born from the Unity of Heaven, which encompasses both essence and qi.[242p]

故曰真曰精。】　　故岁宜以苦燥之温之，甚者发之泄之。不发不泄，则湿气外溢，肉溃皮坼而水血交流。必赞其阳火，令御甚寒。从气异同，少多其判也。同寒者以热化，同湿者以燥化。异者少之，同者多之。用凉远凉，用寒远寒，用温远温，用热远热。食宜同法。假者反之，此其道也，反是者病也。　　【注　苦乃火味，故能燥湿而温寒。判者，分也。】　　帝曰：善！少阴之政奈何？岐伯曰：子午之纪也。　　少阴　太角　阳明　壬子　壬午　其运风鼓，其化鸣紊启坼，其变振拉摧拔，其病支满。　　 【注　与诸太过角运相同。】[243p]

Therefore, it is said that the true essence is refined. Thus, the seasons should be adjusted with bitter and dry warmth; in extreme cases, these should be released. If not released, dampness overflows, leading to flesh decay and skin splitting, causing the mingling of water and blood. One must support the yang fire to resist severe cold. From the harmonies of qi, distinctions in quantity are made. Those with similar cold are transformed by heat; those with similar dampness are transformed by dryness. The differing should be reduced, while the similar should be increased. Use coolness to counter coolness, cold to counter cold, warmth to counter warmth, and heat to counter heat. Eating should follow the same principles. Conversely, if one applies oppositely, that leads to sickness.

The Emperor said: Excellent! How is the governance of the Lesser Yin? Qi Bo replied: It pertains to the intercalary cycle of the yin and yang.

Lesser Yin, Great Horn, Yangming, Renzi, Renwu; its movements are like wind drums, its transformations are chaotic and disruptive; its changes are shaking, pulling, crushing, and lifting; its diseases are fullness and obstruction.[243p]

　　太角 【初正】 　少征　太宫　少商　太羽 【终】　　少阴　太征　阳明　戊子天符　戊午太乙天符　其运炎暑，其化暄曜郁燠，其变炎烈沸腾，其病上热血溢。　　 【注　火运之岁，上见少阴，故曰天符。火运临午，上见少阴，故曰太乙天符。其运与前太征运同。】　　太征　少宫　太商　少羽 【终】 　少角 【终】　　少阴　太宫　阳明　甲子　甲午　其运阴雨，其化柔顺时雨，其变震惊飘骤，其病中满身重。　　 【注　与前太宫运同。】[244p]

Great Horn 【Initial Correctness】 Minor Summoning Great Palace Minor Commerce Great Feather 【Final】 Minor Horn 【Final** Minor Yin Great Summoning Bright Yang Wuzi Heavenly Sign Wuwu Great Yi Heavenly Sign Its operation brings scorching heat; its transformations are warm and radiant; its changes are intensely hot and boiling; its illness manifests as upper heat and overflowing blood. 【Note: In years of fire operation, Minor Yin is seen above, hence it is called Heavenly Sign. When fire operation comes to noon, Minor Yin is seen above, hence it is called Great Yi Heavenly Sign. Its operation is the same as the previous Great Summoning operation.】 Great Summoning Minor Palace Great Commerce Minor Feather 【Final** Minor Horn 【Final** Minor Yin Great Palace Bright Yang Jiazi Jiawu Its operation brings overcast rains; its transformations are gentle, timely rains; its changes are startling and sudden; its illness manifests as fullness and heaviness throughout the body. 【Note: It is the same as the previous Great Palace operation.**[244p]

　　太宫　少商　太羽 【终】 　太角 【终】 　少征　　少阴　太商　阳明　庚子　庚午同正商　其运凉劲，其化雾露萧飋，其变肃杀雕零，其病下清。　　 【注　同正商者，坚成之纪上征与正商同也，运气与太商同。病下清者，感秋金之气也。】　　太商　少羽 【终】 　少角 【初】 　太征　少宫　　少阴　太羽　阳明　丙子岁会　丙午　其运寒，其化凝惨凓冽，其变冰雪霜雹，其病寒下。　　 【注　丙子岁会，则水运临子。其病寒下者，感寒水之气也。】　　太羽 【终】 　太角 【初】 　少征　太宫　少商　　凡此少阴司天之政，气化运行先天。[245p]

Great Palace, Lesser Commerce, Great Feather [End]
Great Angle [End]
Lesser Exertion, Lesser Yin, Great Commerce, Yang Ming, Geng Zi, Geng Wu coincide with the correct Commerce. Its movement is cool and vigorous, its transformation is mist and dew, its change is solemn and chilling, and its affliction is to lower clarity.
[Note: Coinciding with the correct Commerce refers to the time of firm establishment aligning with Lesser Exertion and correct Commerce, its energy akin to Great Commerce. The affliction of lowering clarity is due to the influence of autumn's metal energy.]

Great Commerce, Lesser Feather [End]

Great Exertion, Lesser Palace
Lesser Yin, Great Feather, Yang Ming, during the year of Bing Zi, coincides with Bing Wu. Its movement is cold, its transformation is freezing and gloomy, its change is ice, snow, frost, and hail, and its affliction is coldness affecting clarity.
[Note: During the year of Bing Zi, the water energy is dominant. Its affliction of coldness affecting clarity arises from the influence of cold water energy.]

Great Feather [End]
Great Angle [Beginning]
Lesser Exertion, Great Palace, Lesser Commerce
All these belong to the Lesser Yin's governance of heaven, where the energies and transformations operate according to the primordial.[245p]

地气肃，天气明，寒交暑，热加燥，云驰雨府，湿化乃行，时雨乃降。金火合德，上应荧惑、太白。其政明，其令切，其谷丹白。水火寒热，持于气交，而为病始也。　　【注　太过之岁，气运皆先天时而至。燥金在泉，故地气肃。君火在天，故天气明。岁前之终气，乃少阳相火；今岁之初气，乃太阳寒水。故为寒交暑，而水火寒热持于气交，而为病始也。君火在上，燥金在下。故曰热加燥。云驰雨府，湿化乃行，时雨乃降，即少阳临上，雨乃涯之义。金火合德，上应荧惑、太白光明。明者火之政，切者金之令也。其谷丹白，感金火之气而成熟者。】　　热病生于上，清病生于下，寒热凌犯，而争于中。[246p]

The earth's energy is solemn, the sky's energy is clear; cold meets heat, and warmth adds dryness. Clouds race towards the rain treasury, moisture transforms and then acts, timely rains descend. Metal and fire unite in virtue, corresponding with the comet and Venus. Governance is clear, decrees are strict, and the grains are red and white. Water and fire, cold and heat, interact in the atmosphere, and thus diseases begin.

In years of excess, atmospheric movements arrive according to natural timing. Dry metal is in the springs, hence the earth's energy is solemn. The ruler fire is in the heavens, hence the sky's energy is clear. The end energy before the year is the slight yang fire; the initial energy of the current year is the great yang cold water. Thus, cold meets heat, and water and fire interacting brings forth disease.

The ruler fire above, dry metal below; hence it is said warmth adds dryness. Clouds race to the rain treasury, moisture transforms and then acts, timely rains descend, indicating the slight yang approaching. The conjunction of metal and fire, responding to the comet and bright Venus, indicates clear governance and strict decrees. The grains that are red and white mature under the influence of metal and fire energy.

Heat diseases arise from above, while clear diseases arise from below; cold and heat clash and contend in the middle.[246p]

民病咳喘，血溢血泻鼽嚏，目赤眦疡，寒厥入胃，心痛腰痛，腹大嗌干肿上。　　 【注　寒热凌犯者，司天在泉之气交相犯，而争于中也。咳喘血溢鼽嚏，目赤眦疡，嗌干肿上，热病生于上也。血泻、寒厥，清病生于下也。入胃、心痛、腰痛、腹大，寒热交争于中而为病也。】　　初之气，地气迁，燥将去，寒乃始。蛰复藏，水乃冰。霜复降，风乃至。阳气郁，民反周密，关节禁固，腰脽痛，炎暑将起，中外疮疡。　　 【注　初之客气，乃太阳寒水，故岁前之燥热将去，而寒乃始。蛰虫复藏，冰霜复结也。初之时气，乃厥阴风木，故风乃至。阳春之气郁而民反周密，太阳主筋而为肾之腑，故关节禁固而腰脽痛。时交于二气之君火，故炎暑将至。[247p]

The people suffer from coughs and wheezing, blood disorders, hemorrhages, sneezing, red eyes, eye sores, chills entering the stomach, heart pain, waist pain, and swollen dry throats.

(Note: When cold and heat clash, their forces conflict in the body, causing illness. Coughing, wheezing, blood issues, sneezing, red eyes, eye sores, and swollen dry throats arise from heat diseases, while blood diarrhea and chills come from lower illnesses. Heart pain, waist pain, and abdominal swelling occur from the struggle between cold and heat in the body.)

As the initial qi arrives, the earth’s energy shifts; dryness begins to dissipate, and cold starts to set in. Insects that hibernate now hide away, and water turns to ice. Frost descends again, and the wind arrives. Yang qi stagnates, causing people to feel confined, with stiff joints and waist pain; the heat of summer approaches, leading to internal and external sores.

(Note: The initial guest qi is influenced by the cold water of the Sun, thus the dryness and heat of the previous years will diminish, and cold will begin. Hibernating insects hide away, and frost forms again. The initial energy associated with this is the wind and wood of the Jueyin phase, hence the arrival of the wind. As the spring energy stagnates, people feel confined; the sun governs the tendons associated with the kidney organs, leading to stiff joints and waist pain. The time also coincides with the fire of the two energies, leading to the imminent heat of summer.)[247p]

】　　二之气，阳气布，风乃行，春气以正，万物应荣。寒气时至，民乃和。其病淋，目瞑目赤，气郁于上而热。　　 【注　二之主气，合司天之君火。客气乃厥阴风木，故阳气布，而风乃行。春气始正，万物应生长之气以荣。按：少阴之上，君火主之，少阴标阴而本热。二气三气，皆君火司令，而曰寒气时至者，少阴从本从标也。寒热气交，故民乃和。其病淋目瞑者，寒气之为病也。经云：阳盛则瞋目，阴盛则瞑目。目赤者，君火之气也。气郁于上而热者，寒气上乘也。】　　三之气，天政布，大火行，庶类蕃鲜，寒气时至。民病气厥，心痛，寒热更作，咳喘目赤。　　 【注　三之主气，乃君相二火，故天政布，大火行，众类得长气而蕃鲜。[248p]

The second energy, when the yang energy is spread out, the wind begins to blow, and the spring energy is in harmony, all things respond and flourish. When the cold energy arrives, the people are at peace. The ailments manifest as dysuria, with closed and reddened eyes, indicating stagnant energy above that is hot.

Note: The second energy refers to the main energy, associated with the heavenly sovereign, the fire. The guest energy corresponds to the yin wind wood, thus the yang energy spreads and the wind acts. When spring energy begins to stabilize, all things respond to the growing energy and flourish. It is understood that the upper aspect of the lesser yin is ruled by the sovereign fire, while the lesser yin indicates the yin and originates from heat. Both this energy and the third energy are governed by the sovereign fire, and when it is said that the cold energy has arrived, it means the lesser yin follows the original and indicates. The interaction of cold and heat energy is what brings harmony to the people. The ailments of dysuria and closed eyes pertain to the sickness caused by cold energy. The classics state: when yang is strong, the eyes glare; when yin is strong, the eyes close. Red eyes signify the energy of the sovereign fire. Stagnant energy above that is hot signifies the upper involvement of cold energy.

The third energy, when the heavenly governance is dispersed, the great fire moves, and all creatures thrive abundantly as the cold energy arrives. The people suffer from energy obstruction, experiencing heart pain, alternating cold and heat, cough, shortness of breath, and reddened eyes.

Note: The third energy refers to the main energy, which is the sovereign and mutual fire, thus as the heavenly governance is dispersed and the great fire moves, multitudes receive vital energy and flourish profoundly.[248p]

在下之寒气时至，故民病气厥心痛。盖君火在上，阴寒在下；寒气厥逆凌心，则心痛，而寒热更作。乘于肺，则为咳喘，肺乃心之盖，而又下交于肾也。迫其君火上炎，则目赤。】　　四之气，溽暑至，大雨时行，寒热互至。民病寒热，嗌干黄瘅，鼽衄饮发。　　【注　四之主客，乃湿土主气。湿热气交，故溽暑至，大雨时行，寒热互至也。民病嗌干黄瘅诸证，皆感湿热之气。】　　五之气，畏火临，暑反至，阳乃化。万物乃生乃长荣，民乃康，其病温。　　 【注　岁半以下，及五之主气皆属阳明，而少阳相火加之，故畏长气上临。间气司令，故暑反至，阳乃化，万物得长气而生荣。凉热之气合化，故民乃康。[249p]

As the cold air arrives, the people suffer from heart pain. This is because the ruling fire is above while the coldness is below; when the cold energy oppresses the heart, it results in heart pain, and this causes further fluctuations between cold and heat. When it affects the lungs, it leads to coughing and wheezing, as the lungs are the cover of the heart and connect down to the kidneys. If the ruling fire is forced to rise and inflame, the eyes will turn red.

Regarding the fourth stage, as the hot and humid weather arrives, heavy rains occur, and cold and heat alternate. The people suffer from cold and heat, experiencing dryness of the throat, yellowing of the phlegm, and nasal bleeding.

In the fifth stage, fear of fire arises; the heat returns and the yang transforms. All things grow and flourish, and the people are healthy, although they may be ill from warmth.

For those under half a year old, the primary energy corresponds to the Yangming, with the Shaoyang’s fire accentuating it, hence the fear of ascending and prolonged air. Intermittent energy is in command, causing the heat to return and the yang to transform, allowing all beings to gain vital energy and thrive. The combination of cool and warm energies leads to the health of the people.[249p]

其有灾眚，感温热而为温病。】　　终之气，燥令行，余火内格，肿于上，咳喘，甚则血溢，寒气数举则霿雾翳，病生皮腠，内舍于胁下，连少腹而作寒中。地将易也。　　 【注　终气乃阳明燥金司令，故燥令行，气交之余热内格，而为咳喘血溢诸证。寒水主时，故寒气数举，舍于皮腠，而为病也。夫地支始于子，而对于午。六气已终，则在泉之气，将易而交于丑未矣。】　　必抑其运气，资其岁胜，折其郁发，先取化源，无使暴过而生其病也。　　 【注　运气太过，故当抑之，而资其岁之所不胜。郁发者，五运之气，郁极乃发也。】　　食岁谷以全真气，食间谷以僻虚邪。　　 【注　虚邪，不正之邪也。能保其精，则邪自辟矣。[250p]

When there are disasters and calamities, one feels warmth and heat, resulting in warm diseases. The end of vital qi causes dryness to circulate; residual fire internally conflicts, leading to swelling above, coughing, and wheezing, which, if severe, can result in bleeding. When cold qi increases frequently, it brings about fog and haze, causing illness to manifest on the skin and accumulate below the ribs, extending to the lower abdomen and inducing coldness. The earth is about to change.

(Note: The end of vital qi refers to the Yangming dryness and metal directive, hence causing dryness to circulate. The combination of residual heat leads to symptoms like coughing and bleeding. Cold is governed by seasonal influences, hence an increase in cold qi affects the skin and causes illness. The earth branches begin with Zi and oppose Wu. When the six qi have concluded, the energy of springs is about to change and merge with Chou and Wei.)

One must suppress the operation of qi, support it through favorable years, reduce pent-up energy, and first seek the source of transformation, preventing it from becoming excessive and leading to illness.

(Note: The operation of qi is too strong, hence it should be suppressed and supported to not exceed what the year can bear. Pent-up energy refers to the qi of the five operations, becoming extreme leads to its outbreak.)

Eat harvested grains to maintain true qi; consume processed grains to ward off non-orthodox evils.

(Note: Non-orthodox evils refer to improper and aberrant energies. By safeguarding one's essence, these evils will naturally be repelled.)[250p]

】　　岁宜咸以软之，而调其上；甚则以苦发之，以酸收之，而安其下；甚则以苦泄之。　　 【注　咸从水化，故能软坚，以调和在上之君火。甚则以苦发其火郁。金气主收，故宜酸收以安其下，甚则以苦泻其燥。】　　适气同异而多少之。同天气者，以寒清化；同地气者，以温热化。用热远热，用凉远凉，用温远温，用寒远寒。食宜同法。有假则反，此其道也。反是者病作矣。　　 【注　同司天之热气，宜以寒清。同在泉之清凉者，宜用温热。】　　帝曰：善！厥阴之政奈何？岐伯曰：巳亥之纪也。　　厥阴　少角　少阳　清热胜复同　同正角　丁巳天符　丁亥天符　其运风清热。　　 【注　同正角者，委和之纪，上角与正角同也。[251p]

The year should mainly soften it and adjust what is above; if it is excessive, use bitterness to release it, and sourness to collect it, thus stabilizing what is below; if it is still excessive, use bitterness to drain its dryness.

(Note: The salty element, deriving from water, can soften hardness and harmonize the fire of the lord above. If the fire is too repressed, use bitterness to release its stagnation. The metal element governs collection, so sourness is appropriate to settle that which is below; if it is too dry, then bitterness should drain it.)

The appropriate energies are same and different in quantity. For the same celestial energies, use cold to clarify; for the same terrestrial energies, use warm to transform. Utilize heat to extend heat, coolness to extend coolness, warmth to extend warmth, and cold to extend cold. Eating should follow the same principles. If there is an exception, it will lead to illness.

(Note: The heat from the celestial authority should be clarified with cold. For the refreshing coolness of springs, warm heat should be used.)

The Emperor said: Good! How should the governance of Jueyin be managed? Qibo replied: It pertains to the years of Zi and Hai.

Jueyin, Shaojiao, Shaoyang, Qingre Shengfu all operate similarly; when in the same hexagrams, the phenomena of the upper horn align with the correct horn.[251p]

天符者，木运之岁，上见厥阴也。】　　少角 【初正】 　太征　少宫　太商　少羽 【终】　　厥阴　少征　少阳　寒雨胜复同　癸巳　癸亥　其运热寒雨。　　少征　太宫　少商　太羽 【终】 　太角 【初】　　厥阴　少宫　少阳　风清胜复同　同正角　己巳　己亥　其运雨风清。　　 【注　同正角者，卑监之纪，上角与正角同也。】　　少宫　太商　少羽 【终】 　少角 【初】 　太征　　厥阴　少商　少阳　热寒胜复同　同正角　乙巳　乙亥　其运凉热寒。　　 【注　同正角者，从革之纪，上角与正角同。】　　少商 【乙】 　太羽 【丙终】 　太角 【壬初】 　少征 【癸】 　太宫【甲】　　 【合前注会意。】[252p]

The celestial symbols signify the years governed by wood, where the yin aspect is manifest.

Small horn, initial rectification; great omen, small palace; great commerce, small feather, final. The yin aspect, small omen, small yang, cold rain surpasses and returns to sameness. Year of gui si, year of gui hai, where the movement encompasses heat, cold, and rain.

Small omen, great palace; small commerce, great feather, final; great horn, initial. The yin aspect, small palace, small yang, clear wind surpasses and returns to sameness, the same as the rectifying horn. Year of ji si, year of ji hai, where the movement encompasses rain and clear wind.

Note: The same as the rectifying horn refers to the humble keeper's record, where the upper horn and rectifying horn align.

Small palace, great commerce, small feather, final; small horn, initial; great omen. The yin aspect, small commerce, small yang, heat and cold surpass and return to sameness, the same as the rectifying horn. Year of yi si, year of yi hai, where the movement encompasses coolness, heat, and cold.

Note: The same as the rectifying horn refers to the reformative record, where the upper horn and rectifying horn align.

Small commerce (yi), great feather (bing, final); great horn (ren, initial); small omen (gui); great palace (jia).

This completes the understanding of previous notes.[252p]

　　厥阴　少羽　少阳　雨风胜复同　辛巳　辛亥　其运寒雨风。　　 【注　雨风胜复之气，与风运同化，皆非本年正化，所谓邪化日也，不及之运同。】　　少羽 【辛终】 　少角 【丁初】 　太征 【戊】 　少宫 【已】 　太商【庚】　　 【注　始于丁而终于辛。】
　　凡此厥阴司天之政，气化运行后天。　　 【注　不及之岁气运，皆后天时而至。】　　诸同正岁，气化运行同天。[253p]

The Qi of Jueyin, Shaoyu, and Shaoyang, along with the rain and wind, prevail together. In the years of Xin Sì and Xin Hài, the operation is characterized by cold rain and wind.

(Note: The Qi of rain and wind, which prevails, is not the same as the genuine transformations of the year, known as the transformations of evil, and therefore does not correlate with the proper operations of the year.)

Shaoyu begins in the year of Ding and ends in Xin.

All of this pertains to the governance of heaven by Jueyin, where the Qi transforms and operates through the later heaven.

(Note: The operations of the Qi in years when it does not prevail are those that arrive from the later heaven).

In all shared years, the Qi transforms and operates in the same manner as heaven.[253p]

　　 【注　此言厥阴少阳，标本之相合也。少阳司天，则天气正；少阳在泉，则地气正。谓厥阴同少阳之诸正岁，如厥阴在泉，则厥阴之气，同少阳司天之运行；厥阴司天，则少阳之气，同厥阴司天之运行。故曰风生高远，炎热从之。盖厥阴少阳，标本相合，而厥阴又从少阳之气化也。】　　天气扰，地气正，风生高远，炎热从之。云趋雨府，湿化乃行。风火同德，上应岁星、荧惑。其政挠，其令速，其谷苍丹，间谷言太者。其耗文角品羽。风燥火热，胜复更作。蛰虫来见，流水不冰。热病行于下，风病行于上，风燥胜复形于中。　　【注　风性动摇，故天气扰，少阳之气运行于中，故地气正。风气在天，故风生高远。少阳之气上与厥阴相合，故炎热从之。云趋雨府，湿化乃行者，从风火之胜制也。风火同归于正，故曰同德。上应岁星、荧惑光明。挠者，风之政；速者，火之令。苍丹之谷，感司天在泉之气，而成熟者。[254p]

The text discusses the harmonization of the elements of Yin and Yang, specifically focusing on the interaction between the lesser Yang (少阳) and the extreme Yin (厥阴). It states that when the lesser Yang governs the skies, the atmospheric conditions are correct, and when it is in the springs, the earth’s energy is also proper. It suggests that the energy of extreme Yin is aligned with the operation of lesser Yang, and vice versa.

Consequently, the winds rise high and far, bringing along warmth. Clouds gather to deliver rain, and moisture moves along with it. Wind and fire operate in harmony, responding to the guiding stars above. Political actions may be disrupted, edicts may be issued rapidly, and the grain is a mix of colors indicating its state. There are losses in culture and refinement. Winds bring dryness and heat, which further exacerbate conditions. Hibernating insects emerge, and flowing water does not freeze. Heat-related illnesses arise below, while wind-related ailments occur above, with the dry winds influencing conditions in between.

The passage notes that the nature of wind is to sway, leading to disturbed atmospheric conditions, while the lesser Yang energy operates centrally, thus ensuring the earth's energy remains properly aligned. The presence of wind in the skies causes it to rise high. When lesser Yang energy unites with extreme Yin, warmth follows suit. Clouds and rain occur because of the dominance of wind and fire. The convergence of these forces is described as harmony, responding to the brightness of certain celestial bodies. Political disruptions are attributed to winds, while the rapidity of actions stems from the influence of fire. The mixed grains indicate the first influence of the energy from the heavens at the springs, leading to ripening.[254p]

间谷者，言左之少阴而下，右之太阳而下，感左右之间气而成。文角品羽，感司天在泉之气而生育者，不过文品之毛虫，羽虫又不能生聚而耗散也。胜复更作者，谓炎热从之于上，而复相乘于气交之中也。蛰虫来见，流水不冰，相火之在泉也。感风气，则病行于上，感热气则病行于下，风燥胜复相乘，则形见于气交之中。愚谓行于上，行于下，又曰形于中，而不曰病，盖谓风火之气行于上下，而复交于中也。炎热从之于上者，子从母也。[255p]

The term "Jian Gu" refers to the influences coming from the left, which is associated with the lesser yin, and the right, associated with the greater yang, where the energies of both sides converge. The ornamental horns of various creatures are born from the vitality of the heavens in the springs, but they are simply a manifestation of the nourishing essence, while the feathered beings cannot multiply and instead dissipate. The transformation following this leads to intense heat emanating from above, which compounds with the energies where they intersect. When hibernating insects emerge, water flows without freezing, indicating the presence of fire in the springs. When the wind energy is felt, illness arises from above; and when heat energy is felt, illness manifests below. If the wind and dryness exacerbate one another, the form becomes evident in the intersection of energies. In my humble opinion, the movements occurring above and below, referred to as manifestations in the middle, do not simply denote illness; they indicate the operations of wind and fire energies traveling up and down, intersecting in the center. The intense heat emanating from above follows the lineage from mother to child.[255p]

胜复更作者，厥阴之气，复下归于正也。故厥阴在泉，则地气正。今厥阴司天，而天气亦正，斯谓之诸同正岁。】　　初之气，寒始肃，杀气方至，民病寒于右之下。　　 【注　初之气，乃阳明清金司令，故寒始肃，而杀气方至。民病寒于右之下，谓阳明之间气在在泉，少阳之右也。】　　二之气，寒不去，华雪水冰，杀气施化，霜乃降，名草上焦，寒雨数至，阳复化，民病热于中。　　 【注　二之间气，乃太阳寒水，是以寒不去而霜乃降。[256p]

The victory of renewal is characterized by the return of the Yin energy downwards, returning to its proper state. Therefore, when Yin energy is at the spring, the earth's energy is in harmony. Now, since Yin energy governs the heavens and the atmospheric energy is also correct, this is referred to as the year of mutual correctness.

In the initial phase of energy, the cold begins to become austere, and the killing energy begins to arrive, causing the people to suffer from the cold beneath the right side.

(Note: The initial phase of energy is governed by the Clear Metal of Yangming; hence, the cold begins to become austere, and the killing energy begins to arrive. The people suffer from the cold beneath the right side, referring to the energy between Yangming and the spring, which is on the right of Shaoyang.)

In the second phase of energy, the cold does not dissipate, resulting in floral snow and icy water; the killing energy manifests, and frost begins to fall, which is named the upper combustion of the grass. The cold rains come frequently, and the Yang energy begins to transform, causing the people to suffer from internal heat.

(Note: The energy in the second phase is governed by the cold water of Taiyang; hence, the cold does not dissipate and frost begins to fall.)[256p]

二之主气，乃少阴君火，而寒水加临于上，是以名草上焦而阳复化于下也。民病热中者，君火之气，为寒气郁于内也。】　　三之气，天政布，风乃时举，民病泣出，耳鸣掉眩。　　 【注　三之气，乃司天之风气主令，是以天政布，风乃时举。民病泣出耳鸣掉眩，乃风病行于上也。】　　四之气，溽暑湿热相薄，争于左之上。民病黄瘅而为胕肿。　　 【注　四之客气，乃少阴君火，主气乃太阴湿土，故溽暑湿热相薄。[257p]

The energy of the second type is the fire of the Lord of Lesser Yin, while cold water is imposed above it; thus it is named the upper focus of plants, and yang transforms again below. Those among the populace who suffer from internal heat are afflicted by the energy of the Lord of Fire, as cold energy is congested within.

The energy of the third type, governed by heavenly authority, brings forth the wind at appropriate times; thus the people suffer from crying out, ear noises, and dizziness.

The energy of the fourth type involves unpleasant heat and humidity competing above to the left. People are afflicted with jaundice and swellings.

The guest energy of the fourth type is the fire of the Lord of Lesser Yin, while the primary energy is the damp earth of the Great Yin; hence the unpleasant heat and humidity are in conflict.[257p]

争于左之上者，谓少阴在司天，厥阴之左也。民病黄瘅胕肿，皆湿热之为病。】　　五之气，燥湿更胜，沉阴乃布，寒气及体，风雨乃行。　　 【注　五之客气，乃太阴湿土，主气乃阳明燥金。故燥湿更胜，沉阴布。寒及体者，二气并主清寒也。太阴所至，终为雨，阳明所至为凄鸣，故风雨乃行。】　　终之气，畏火司令，阳乃大化，蛰虫出见，流水不冰，地气大发，草乃生，人乃舒。其病温厉。　　 【注　终之主气，乃太阳寒水，而相火加临于上，故畏火司令。客胜其主，是以阳气大化。[258p]

Those contending above the left are said to have the Minor Yin presiding over the heavens, which is the left of the Major Yin. The people's ailments of yellow, malaise, and swelling are all caused by damp heat. The five vital energies show that dryness and dampness are predominant, the heavy Yin is dispersed, the cold energy reaches the body, and wind and rain are moving.

Note: The guest energy of the five corresponds to the Tai Yin (great Yin) which is damp earth, while the main energy is the Yang Ming (yang brightness) which is dry metal. Thus, as dryness overcomes dampness, the heavy Yin disperses. When cold reaches the body, both energies predominantly govern coolness. When the Tai Yin has influence, it ultimately leads to rain, while the Yang Ming leads to desolation; therefore, wind and rain move.

The final energy fears the commanding fire; thus, Yang undergoes significant transformation, dormant insects emerge, flowing water does not freeze, the earth's energy is abundant, grass begins to grow, and people feel at ease. Their ailments are severe and warm.

Note: The final governing energy is the Tai Yang (greater Yang) which is cold water, while the rising fire presses strongly above, thus it fears the commanding fire. When the guest overcomes the master, the Yang energy undergoes significant transformation.[258p]

流水不冰，少阳在泉之气大发，草感生长之气而生，人感温暖之气而舒。其病温厉者，所谓冬温病也。】　　必折其郁气，资其化源。赞其运气，无使邪胜。　　 【注　化源者，五运乃六气之生源。如少宫之运，厥阴司天，则土气受郁矣；少商之运，少阳在泉，则金气受郁矣。故当折其致郁之气，以资五运之化源。以上六气相同。岁运不及，故当赞助其运气，无使所不胜之邪胜之。以上不及之三气相同。】　　岁宜辛以调上，以咸调下。畏火之气，无妄犯之。[259p]

Flowing water does not freeze; when the lesser yang energy in the spring greatly manifests, the grass responds to the vital energy of growth and flourishes, while people feel the warmth and become at ease. Those suffering from intense warmth are what is termed winter warmth disease. One must eliminate the stagnant energy and support the source of transformation. Encourage the flow of vital energy to ensure that evils do not prevail.

The source of transformation refers to the five movements, which are the origins of the six energies. For instance, when the movement of lesser palace governs the ultimate yin, the earth energy becomes stagnant; when the movement of lesser merchant occurs, the lesser yang at the spring causes the metal energy to become stagnant. Therefore, one should alleviate the energy causing stagnation to nourish the transformation from the five movements. The six energies are fundamentally similar. When the yearly movement is insufficient, one must support the flow of vital energy to prevent those evils from prevailing over the insufficient energies. The above holds true for the three energies that are inadequate.

In a year, it is advisable to use metal to harmonize the upper aspects and salt to adjust the lower. Be wary of the fire energy and do not recklessly provoke it.[259p]

　　 【注　辛从金化，以调风木之胜；咸从水化，以调火热之淫。厥阴不从标本，从中见少阳之火化，是一岁之中，皆火司令，故当畏火之气，无妄犯之。】　　岁宜辛以调上，以咸调下。畏火之气，无妄犯之。　　 【注　辛从金化，以调风木之胜；咸从水化，以调火热之淫。厥阴不从标本，从中见少阳之火化，是一岁之中，皆火司令，故当畏火之气，无妄犯之。】　　用温远温，用热远热，用凉远凉，用寒远寒。食宜同法。有假反常，此之道也。反是者病。
　　 【注　厥阴司气，以温用温无犯；少阳司气，以热用热无犯。食宜同法者，药食并宜也。】　　帝曰：善。夫子之言可谓悉矣！然何以明其应乎？岐伯曰，昭乎哉，问也！夫六气者，行有次，止有位。故常以正月朔日平旦视之，睹其位而知其所在矣。　　【注　言司天在泉之气，六期环转，而各有定位也。[260p]

Note: Xīn is transformed from metal to balance the dominance of wood; Xián transforms from water to temper the excess heat of fire. The Jueyin does not follow the standard reference but reveals the fire of Shaoyang from within; thus, in every year, fire governs. Therefore, one must fear the essence of fire and avoid reckless actions.

The year should utilize Xīn to balance the upper, while Xián balances the lower. Fear the essence of fire and refrain from reckless behavior.

Note: Xīn is transformed from metal to balance the dominance of wood; Xián transforms from water to temper the excess heat of fire. The Jueyin does not follow the standard reference but reveals the fire of Shaoyang from within; thus, in every year, fire governs. Therefore, one must fear the essence of fire and avoid reckless actions.

Use warmth to counter warmth, heat to counter heat, coolness to counter coolness, and coldness to counter coldness. Eating should follow the same principles. If there are deviations from the norm, this is the way. Those who stray will face illness.

Note: Jueyin governs energy; when using warmth, do so without transgression; Shaoyang governs energy; when using heat, do so without transgression. The principle of dietary methods applies to both food and medicine.

The Emperor said: Good. The words of the Master are certainly comprehensive! However, how can one clarify these responses? Qí Bó replied, Indeed, a wise inquiry! The six energies have their sequences and fixed positions. Therefore, one should observe them at dawn on the first day of the first month and discern their positions to know their whereabouts.

Note: This refers to the celestial energies at the spring equinox. The six seasonal periods rotate with each having its designated position.[260p]

行有次者，少阳之右，阳明治之；阳明之右，太阳治之；太阳之右，厥阴治之；厥阴之右，少阴治之；少阴之右，太阴治之；大阴之右，少阳治之。六气终期，而六期环会也。止有位者，上下有位，左右有纪，一气各主六十日有奇也。以正月朔日平旦视之者，盖以寅为岁之首，朔为月之首，寅为日之首，而起初气也。睹其司天在泉之定位，则知六气所在矣。】　　运有余，其至先；运不及，其至后。此天之道，气之常也。运非有余、非不足，是谓正岁。其至当其时也。　　 【注　运谓六气之化运。如子午寅申辰戌六岁主有余，其主岁主时之气，皆先天时而至。[261p]

When the paths move in sequence, the right side of Shao Yang is governed by Yang Ming; the right side of Yang Ming is governed by Tai Yang; the right side of Tai Yang is governed by Jue Yin; the right side of Jue Yin is governed by Shao Yin; the right side of Shao Yin is governed by Tai Yin; the right side of Tai Yin is governed by Shao Yang. The six energies reach their end, and the six phases converge. Where there is a position, there are ranks above and below, and rules on the left and right, with each energy presiding over sixty days uniquely. When observing from the dawn of the first day of the first month, it is evident that Yin is the beginning of the year, the new moon is the beginning of the month, and Yin is the beginning of the day, marking the initiation of energy. By observing its heavenly overseer located at the spring, one can discern where the six energies are situated.

When movement is excessive, its arrival is early; when movement is insufficient, its arrival is late. This reflects the way of heaven, the constancy of energy. When the movement is neither excessive nor insufficient, this is called the correct year, and its arrival corresponds to the proper time.

(Note: Movement refers to the transformation and motion of the six energies. For instance, when the ages of Zi, Wu, Yin, Shen, Chen, and Xu are dominant, their respective affects arrive ahead of the seasonal times.)[261p]

如丑未卯酉巳亥六岁主不及，其主岁主时之气，皆后天时而至。正岁为岁会之纪，非大过，非不及，其气应时而至也。】　　帝曰：胜复之气，其常在也。灾眚时至，候也奈何？岐伯曰：非气化者，是谓灾也。　　 【注　此论五运之胜复，而为灾眚者，何以候之。非气化者，谓非运气之化也。如丁卯丁酉岁，其运风清热。风乃少角之气化，其清热乃胜复之气。此邪化也，是谓灾眚。[262p]

If one is not in harmony with the years of the Rat, Rabbit, Rooster, Snake, and Pig in the six-year cycle, then the energy of that year cannot reach its master. The true year aligns with the time of the year's meeting; it is neither excessive nor insufficient, and its energy arrives in accordance with the time. The Emperor asked, "Regarding the energy of victory and renewal, how can it be predicted when disasters occur?" Qi Bo replied, "If it is not a transformation of energy, it is called a disaster." In this discussion on the prevalence of the five movements and the occurrence of disasters, the question is how to foresee them. What is called "not a transformation of energy" refers to a state not influenced by the energy of the cycles. For example, in the years of Ding Yin and Ding You, the energy manifests as a clear, warm wind. The wind represents the transformation of lesser angles, while the warmth signifies the energy of victory and renewal. This is considered a malignant transformation and is thus referred to as disaster.[262p]

】　　帝曰：天地之数，终始奈何？岐伯曰：悉乎哉，问也！是明道也。数之始，起于上而终于下。岁半之前，天气主之；岁半之后，地气主之。上下交互，气交主之。岁纪毕矣。故曰位明气月可知乎？所谓气也。　　 【注　天谓司天，地谓在泉，道谓天地阴阳之道。数之始起于上者，谓数之始于一，而起于天一也；终于地者，谓天数之始于一，而终于地六也。岁半之前、岁半之后者，谓天地之气，上下有位也。气交者，谓天地之气，上下相交也。位谓司天在泉，及左右间气之六位。气月谓一气之各主两月也。[263p]

The Emperor said: "What is the relationship of the numbers of Heaven and Earth from beginning to end?" Qibo replied: "Indeed! It is a profound question! This is the way of illumination. The beginning of numbers rises from above and ends below. Half a year before, it is ruled by the heavenly energy; half a year after, it is ruled by the earthly energy. The interaction of up and down, the mutual influence of energies, governs everything. Thus, the year is completed. Hence it is said: can you know the positions of the luminous energies and the months? This is what is meant by ‘energy.’"

[Note: "Heaven" refers to the governorship of Heaven, "Earth" refers to the presence of springs, and "Way" refers to the way of the balance of Yin and Yang of Heaven and Earth. The beginning of numbers rising from above means that numbers begin with one, starting from the heavenly one; it ending at earth means that the heavenly numbers begin with one and end at earth six. "Half a year before" and "half a year after" refer to the positions of energies in Heaven and Earth, showing their arrangement above and below. The mutual influence of energies means the intersecting of heavenly and earthly energies. "Position" refers to the governorship in the springs and the six positions of energy in the left and right. "Energy and months" refers to each energy governing two months.][263p]

】　　帝曰：余司其事，则而行之，不合其数，何也？岐伯曰：气用有多少，化洽有盛衰。盛衰多少，同其化也。帝曰：愿闻同化，何如？岐伯曰：风温春化同，热曛昏火夏化同，胜与复同。燥清烟雾秋化同，云雨昏暝埃长夏化同，寒气霜雪冰冬化同。此天地五运六气之化，更用盛衰之常也。　　【注　不合其数者，不合六气之数也。气用有多少者，六气之用，有有余不足也。化洽有盛衰者，五运之化，有太过不及也。风热暴燥者，阴阳之六气也。春夏秋冬者，角征宫商羽，主岁而主时也。风温春化同者，厥阴与角运同化也。热曛夏化同者，少阴少阳与征运同化也。胜与复同者，五运之胜与复气，亦与六气之相同也。如清金胜角木，其胜气即与阳明同；炎火复秋金，其复气即与少阴少阳同也。此天地五运六气之化，更用盛衰之常，是以有不合也。如风温之多合春化之盛，是气运同其化矣。若六气之少合五运之盛，五运之衰合六气之多，此盛衰更用而不合矣。[264p]

The Emperor said: "If I oversee this, then act accordingly; if it does not match the numbers, why is that?" Qi Bo replied: "The use of qi varies in quantity, and transformation has its rise and fall. The rise and fall correspond to transformation." The Emperor said: "I wish to understand this correspondence in transformation; how is it?" Qi Bo replied: "The warmth of spring transforms with the wind, the heat of summer aligns with dusk and the blaze of fire, and the victories and returns correspond. The dryness and clarity of autumn transforms with smoke and haze, while clouds and rain correspond with dusk and the lingering dust of late summer. The coldness with frost, snow, and ice transforms with winter. These variations of the five movements and six qi are governed by constants of rise and fall."

(Note: "Not matching the numbers" refers to not aligning with the six qi. "The use of qi varies in quantity" indicates that the application of the six qi can be excessive or insufficient. "Transformation has its rise and fall" signifies that the five movements' transformations can be too much or too little. "Wind, heat, and dryness" refer to the six qi of yin and yang. "Spring, summer, autumn, and winter" correlate with the musical notes of jiao, zheng, gong, shang, and yu, which govern both the year and time. "The warmth of spring transforming with the wind" refers to the union of jueyin and the jiao movement. "The heat of summer transforming with dusk" relates to the union of shaoyin and shao yang with the zheng movement. "Victories and returns" correspond to the five movements of victory and return, which also relate to the six qi. For instance, the clear metal overcomes the wood of jiao; this overcoming qi aligns with yangming; the blazing fire returns over the autumn metal, and this returning qi aligns with shaoyin and shao yang. This is why there may be discrepancies: if the abundance of warm wind corresponds too closely to the flourishing of spring, then the qi movement aligns with its transformation. Conversely, if the six qi insufficiently matches the abundance of the five movements, and the decline of the five movements corresponds with the abundance of the six qi, then this rise and fall is in disharmony.)[264p]

】　　帝曰：五运行同天化者，命曰天符，余知之矣。愿闻同地化者，何谓也？岐伯曰：太过而同天化者三，不及而同天化者亦三；太过而同地化者三，不及而同地化者亦三。此凡二十四岁也。帝曰：愿闻其所谓也！岐伯曰：甲辰、甲戌、太宫，下加太阴；壬寅、壬申、太角，下加厥阴；庚子、庚午、太商，下加阳明。如是者三。　　【注　此太过而同地化者三，运合六气，计六岁。[265p]

The Emperor said: "The five movements that align with the transformations of heaven are called heavenly symbols; I understand this. I wish to hear about those that align with the transformations of the earth—what does that mean?" Qi Bo replied: "There are three that align with the transformations of heaven when there is excess, and three that align when there is deficiency; similarly, three align with the transformations of earth when there is excess, and three that align when there is deficiency. This amounts to a total of twenty-four ages." The Emperor said: "I wish to hear what these are!" Qi Bo replied: "Jia Chen, Jia Xu, Tai Gong, which corresponds to the Tai Yin below; Ren Yin, Ren Shen, Tai Jiao, which corresponds to Jue Yin below; Geng Zi, Geng Wu, Tai Shang, which corresponds to Yang Ming below. Thus, there are three in total." 【Note: These three that align with the transformations of earth during excess involve the six vital energies, totaling six ages.】[265p]

】　　癸巳、癸亥、少征，下加少阳；辛丑、辛未、少羽，下加太阳；癸卯、癸酉、少征，下加少阴。如是者三。　　 【注　此不及而同地化者三，运合六气，计六年。】　　戊子、戊午、太征，上临少阴；戊寅、戊申、太征，上临少阳；丙辰、丙戌、太羽，上临太阳。如是者三。　　 【注　此太过而同天化者三，运合六气，计六年。】　　丁巳、丁亥、少角，上临厥阴；乙卯、乙酉、少商，上临阳明；己丑、己未、少宫，上临太阴。如是者三。　　 【注　此不及而同天化者三，运合六气，计六年。】　　除此二十四岁，则不加不临也。[266p]

In the years of Gui Si and Gui Hai, with Lesser Movement, there will be a conjunction with Lesser Yang; in Xin Chou and Xin Wei, with Lesser Feather, there will be a conjunction with Greater Yang; in Gui Yin and Gui You, with Lesser Movement, there will be a conjunction with Lesser Yin. This pattern occurs three times. 【Note: These three do not correspond and transform in the same location, but they harmonize the six energies, totaling six years.】

In the years of Wu Zi and Wu Wu, with Greater Movement, it will be influenced by Lesser Yin; in Wu Yin and Wu Shen, with Greater Movement, it will be influenced by Lesser Yang; in Bing Chen and Bing Xu, with Greater Feather, it will be influenced by Greater Yang. This pattern occurs three times. 【Note: These three are excessive and transform in the same sky, harmonizing the six energies, totaling six years.】

In the years of Ding Si and Ding Hai, with Lesser Horn, it will be influenced by Jue Yin; in Yi Yin and Yi You, with Lesser Commerce, it will be influenced by Yang Ming; in Ji Chou and Ji Wei, with Lesser Palace, it will be influenced by Greater Yin. This pattern occurs three times. 【Note: These three do not correspond and transform in the same sky, harmonizing the six energies, totaling six years.】

Apart from these twenty-four years, there is no addition or influence.[266p]

　　 【注　言此二十四岁，则上下加临，余三十六岁，则不加不临也。】　　帝曰：加者何谓？岐伯曰：太过而加同天符，不及而加同岁会也。　　 【注　此言太过而同地化者与天符相同，不及而同地化者与岁会相同。】　　帝曰：临者何谓？岐伯曰：太过不及，皆曰天符。而变行有多少，病形有微甚，生死有早晏耳。　　 【注　太过不及之十二岁，皆曰天符，然内有变行多少之分焉。多少者，即太过不及之变也。太过者暴，不及者徐。暴者为病甚，徐者为病持。故有微甚死生之分焉。】　　帝曰：夫子言，用寒远寒，用热远热。余未知其然也。愿闻何谓远？岐伯曰：热无犯热，寒无犯寒。从者和，逆者病。[267p]

[Commentary: At twenty-four years, both the upper and lower aspects experience influence; at thirty-six years, there is neither influence nor intrusion.] The Emperor asked: What does "influence" mean? Qibo replied: When there is excessive increase, it corresponds to the celestial decree; when there is insufficient increase, it corresponds to the yearly assembly. [Commentary: This speaks to how excessive increase corresponds with celestial decrees and insufficient increase corresponds with yearly assemblies.] The Emperor asked: What does "intrusion" mean? Qibo replied: Excess and deficiency both refer to the celestial decree. However, the variations in conduct differ in magnitude, the manifestations of illness vary in severity, and life and death are marked by early or late timings. [Commentary: The twelve years of excess and deficiency are all referred to as celestial decrees, yet within there are distinctions in the variances of conduct. The magnitudes refer to the variations of excess and deficiency. Excess is abrupt, while deficiency is gradual. Abrupt means severe illness, while gradual means long-lasting illness. Hence, there are distinctions between slight and severe outcomes of life and death.] The Emperor said: The Master spoke of using cold to approach cold, and using heat to approach heat. I do not understand this. I wish to know what is meant by "approach." Qibo replied: Heat should not provoke heat, and cold should not provoke cold. Following the right path brings harmony, while going against it results in sickness.[267p]

不可不敬畏而远之。所谓时兴六位也。　　 【注　此总言一岁之中，有应时而起之六位，各主六十日零八十七刻半，各有寒热温凉之四气，皆宜远而无犯之。如初之气，天气尚寒，是宜用热，时值少阳相火司令，又当远此一位而无犯也。如二之气，天气已温，是宜用凉，时值太阳寒水司令，又当远此一位而用凉也。每岁之六气皆然。从则和，逆则病，不可不敬畏而远之。】　　帝曰：温凉何如？岐伯曰：司气以热用热无犯，司气以寒用寒无犯，司气以凉用凉无犯，司气以温用温无犯。间气同其主无犯，异其主则小犯之。是谓四畏，必谨察之。　　【注　此论司天在泉及间气之无犯也。如少阴在上，司气以热而用热者，又当远此少阴之热而无犯也。[268p]

One must not fail to respect and fear these (concepts) while keeping a distance. This is referred to as the six positions that arise in a year.

(Note: This passage generally states that within a year, there are six positions that respond to the seasons, each governing sixty days and eighty-seven and a half beats, each associated with four seasonal temperatures: cold, hot, warm, and cool. It is advisable to keep your distance and not interfere with them. For instance, in the initial phase, when the weather is still cold, it is appropriate to use warmth. During this time, the lesser yang is in charge, so one should avoid this position and not interfere. In the second phase, as the weather becomes warm, it is appropriate to use coolness; in this case, the greater yang governs, so again, one should avoid this position and utilize cooling instead. This applies to all six seasonal energies each year. Following the proper flow leads to harmony, while acting against it causes illness; one must respect and fear these energies and keep a distance.)

The Emperor asked: What about warmth and coolness? Qi Bo replied: If the energy is governed by heat, then use warmth without interference; if governed by cold, use coolness without interference. If governed by coolness, use coolness without interference; if governed by warmth, use warmth without interference. When energies are the same as their rulers, one should not interfere; when they differ, minor interference is allowed. This is known as the four fears, and one must be careful to observe them.

(Note: This discussion concerns the governance of heavenly energies in relation to the groundwater and the concept of non-interference. For example, when the lesser yin is in the higher position, and if it governs heat and warmth, one should also avoid this lesser yin warmth and not interfere.)[268p]

如阳明在泉，司气以凉而用凉者，又当远此阳明之凉而无犯也。余气皆然。如间气与司天在泉之主气相同者不可犯，与主气异者则小犯之。假如少阳司天，初气乃少阴君火，是与司天之气相同，无犯其热。如少阴在泉四之气，乃太阳寒水，是与主气相异，可少用热而小犯之。是谓寒热温凉之四畏，不可不谨察也。】　　帝曰：善！其犯者何如？岐伯曰：天气反时，则可依时则可依时　王冰注云：反甚为病，则可依时。《素问》六元正纪大论原作「则可依则」。。及胜其主，则可犯。以平为期，而不可过。是谓邪气反胜者。　　 【注　天气反时者，如司气以热，而天气反凉，是当依时而用温。如司气以热，而寒反胜之，又可用热而犯主气之热矣。[269p]

Like the sun illuminating a spring, one governs the energies with coolness and employs the cool. One should keep a distance from this cooling of the sun and not transgress it. The same applies to all other energies. If the intervening energy matches the governing energy of the heavens in the spring, it must not be transgressed; if it differs, then a minor transgression is permitted. For instance, if the lesser yang governs the heavens and the initial energy is the lesser yin fire, then it corresponds with the energy of the heavens and one must not transgress its heat. However, if the lesser yin is in the spring with the four energies, and the greater yang is cold water, this differs from the governing energy, allowing a slight use of heat and a minor transgression. This is called the four apprehensions of cold, heat, warmth, and coolness, which must be carefully considered.

The Emperor said: Good! What about transgressors? Qi Bo replied: When the energies of the heavens oppose the seasonal timing, one may adhere to the season. Wang Bing commented that severe opposition is a sickness that can then follow the timing. In cases where one overcomes the main energy, a transgression is permitted. Balance is the benchmark, and one must not exceed it. This is termed the situation where the evil energy opposes and overcomes.

Note: When the energies of the heavens oppose the seasonal timing, such as when heat is governed but the heavenly energy opposes with coolness, one should adhere to the timing and employ warmth. If heat is governed while cold overcomes, one can use heat and transgress the governing heat.[269p]

然止以气平为期，不可过用以伤司气之元真。是谓邪气反胜者，则可犯也。】　　故曰：无失天信，无逆气宜，无翼其胜，无赞其复。是谓至治。　　 【注　天信谓气应时而至者，无差失而妄犯之。六气各有所宜而不可逆。有胜气，又宜折之而无翼其胜。有复气，又当抑之而无赞其复。调之正味，使上下合德，无相夺伦。五运和平，是谓至治。】　　帝曰：善！五运气行，主岁之纪，其有常数乎？岐伯曰：臣请次之！　　 【注　此与上篇大义相同，前以太阳为始，序三阳三阴之六气；以角运为初，序角征宫商羽之五音，而年岁有所不齐也。故今以天干始于甲，地支始于子，从甲子而至癸巳，三十岁而为一纪；复从甲午而至癸亥，六十岁而为一周。斯岁运始顺，故复次之。】　　甲子　甲午岁[270p]

The passage discusses the importance of maintaining balance with the natural energies and warns against excessive use that harms the original true essence of vitality. It cautions that if malevolent energies overwhelm, one can fall into danger. Therefore, it is advised to avoid losing trust in heavenly signs, to not oppose appropriate energies, to refrain from supporting harmful influences, and to not encourage negative cycles. This is termed the ultimate governance.

The "heavenly sign" refers to qi arriving at the right time without deviation that leads to wrongful actions. Each of the six energies has its proper conditions and should not be opposed. If there are prevailing energies, they should be restrained rather than supported. Likewise, if there are recovering energies, they should be suppressed instead of encouraged. Achieving harmony in the right essence ensures that above and below align with virtue, preventing disruption of order. When the five movements and energies are in balance, it is said to be the ultimate governance.

The Emperor then asks if the circulation of the five energies and their relation to the annual cycles has fixed constants. Qi Bo responds that he wishes to elaborate on this further.

This aligns with the previous section, which begins with the sun and arranges the six energies of the three yangs and three yins, as well as beginning with the angle movements and sequence of the five tones, noting that years do not always align evenly. Thus, starting with the heavenly stems at Jia and the earthly branches at Zi, each cycle completes after thirty years with Jia Zi to Gui Si; and again from Jia Wu to Gui Hai, completing a full cycle after sixty years. Accordingly, successful years follow this order.[270p]

　　上少阴火　中太宫土运　下阳明金　热化二　　【注　天一生水，地六成之；地二生火，天七成之；天三生木，地八成之；地四生金，天九成之；天五生土，地十成之。天干始于甲，地支始于子，故其数从生始。】　　雨化五
　　 【注　此运居其中，太过者其数成，不及者其数生。雨为土化，土常以生，故其数五。】　　燥化四
　　 【注　乃己卯、己酉也。己主不及，故其数生。】　　所谓正化日也。
　　 【注　无胜复之邪化，故为正化。所谓日者，以一运统主一岁，而五运又以角木为初，羽水为终，各分主七十二日有奇也。】　　其化上咸寒，中苦热，下酸热。所谓药食宜也。　　 【注　上谓司天，下谓在泉，中谓化运。君火司天，故宜咸寒以制化。太阴湿土运化于中，故宜苦以燥湿，热以温阴。阳明清凉在泉，故宜酸以助收热。以温凉药食并相宜也。】　　乙丑　乙未岁[271p]

The upper aspect is Lesser Yin Fire, the middle aspect is Tai Gong Earth, the lower aspect is Yang Ming Metal, transforming heat into two.

[Note: Heaven generates Water, and Earth perfects it; Earth generates Fire, and Heaven perfects it; Heaven generates Wood, and Earth perfects it; Earth generates Metal, and Heaven perfects it; Earth generates Soil, and Heaven perfects it. The Heavenly Stems begin with Jia, and the Earthly Branches begin with Zi, thus their numbers start from generation.]

Rain transforms into five.

[Note: This cycle resides in the center; if excessive, its number completes, if insufficient, its number generates. Rain signifies the transformation of Earth, which commonly produces, hence its number is five.]

Dryness transforms into four.

[Note: This refers to Ji Mao and Ji You. Ji indicates insufficiency, hence its number generates.]

This is called the proper transformation day.

[Note: There is no overpowering or returning malady in its transformation, hence it is called the proper transformation. The term "day" refers to one cycle presiding over one year, and the five cycles take the angle of Wood as the beginning and the feather of Water as the end, each governing seventy-two days with a quirk.]

The transformations involve upper aspects being salty and cold, the middle being bitter and hot, and the lower being sour and hot. These are termed medicinal foods.

[Note: The upper aspect refers to Heaven, the lower to springs, and the middle to transformation. The Lord Fire presides over Heaven, thus salty and cold balance the transformation. The Tai Yin moist Earth, transforming in the center, thus requires bitterness to dry and heat to warm Yin. Yang Ming is cool in the springs, thus requires sourness to help gather heat. Therefore, warming and cooling medicinal foods are both suitable.]

The years are Yi Chou and Yi Wei.[271p]

　　上太阴土　中少商金运　下太阳水　热化寒化胜复同，所谓邪气化日也。　　 【注　不及之运有胜复。金运不及，火热胜之。金之子寒水来复，有胜复之邪气，故为邪化。所谓日者，谓胜气在，胜彼所主之七十二日；复气在，复我所司之七十二日。此即上章清热胜复同、其运风清热之义。余不及岁，俱准此。】　　灾七宫
　　 【注　按九宫分野，七乃兑宫。金运不及，为热寒胜复，故主灾眚。在于兑之西方上，以太过之岁，而主民病。此以不及之岁，而言灾眚。盖太过之气暴，不及之气徐，病甚而灾微也。】　　湿化五
　　 【注　乙主不及，故其数生。按乙运不及，则丑未之司天在泉亦主不及，气运之同也。】　　清化四
　　 【注　运不及，故其数生。余不及岁，俱准此。】　　寒化六[272p]

Above is the influence of the Great Yin Earth, in the middle is the operation of the Lesser Merchants Metal, and below is the Great Yin Water. The heat and cold transformations are both aligned; this is called the transformation of evil qi.

(Note: The operation that does not reach has a counteracting effect. When the Metal operation is insufficient, the heat overcomes it. The cold water of Metal's offspring returns with a counteracting evil qi, thus it is termed evil transformation. The "sun" refers to the prevailing qi present, overcoming its governing period of seventy-two days; the returning qi occupies the seventy-two days governed by myself. This aligns with the previous chapter on clear heat and mutual overcoming, expressing the operation of wind with clear heat. For years that do not reach this standard, the same principle applies.)

Disasters in the Seventh Palace

(Note: According to the division of the Nine Palaces, the seventh is the Dui Palace. When the Metal operation is insufficient, it leads to the overcoming of heat and cold, hence causing disasters and calamities. This is located in the western upper part of Dui, during an excessively productive year, resulting in illness among the populace. Hence, in years that do not reach the standard, disasters and calamities are discussed. The excessive qi is abrupt while the insufficient qi is gradual, causing significant ailments but minor disasters.)

Moisture transforms into the Five

(Note: The Yin signifies insufficiency, hence this number arises. When the Yin operation is inadequate, the heavenly overseers of the Ox and Sheep in the spring also signify insufficiency; such is the nature of qi operations.)

Clear transformation into the Four

(Note: The operation does not reach, hence this number arises. For years that do not reach this standard, the same principle applies.)

Cold transformation into the Six.[272p]

　　 【注　乃庚辰、庚戌也。庚主太过，故其数成。】　　所谓正化日也。
　　 【注　湿化五，清化四，寒化六，皆主正化，无胜复之邪气也。五运之气，又各分主七十二日。司天在泉之气，各主六十日而有奇。】　　其化上苦热，中酸和，下甘热。所谓药食宜也。　　 【注　金气主收，故宜酸以收之。和谓五运之气，虽各主一岁，而一岁之中，又有生长化收藏之五运，故又宜五味以和之。甘为土味，能制化寒水。】　　丙寅　丙申岁

　　 【注　运太过，故其数成。余太过运俱准此。】　　风化三
